40945163.review:
Really good game. At first glance it is a classic quest, but then I've realised that it mre like role playing game because of lot of NPCs, beautifully voiced dialogs, large world and very solid, creative and intriguing storyline. It was interesting to play this game, however it took about 25 hours time to beat this journey (I've played mostly offline so Steam couldn't count all time). 

For me TLJ is actually a mobile game. I've tried it on my computer. It is possible to run it in windowed mode. 
C:\users\<user>\AppData\Roaming\The Longest Journey\preferences.ini
I had to add this two lines to get windowed mode: 
[DirectX] 
bool_StartFullscreen=0


But the picture was small and it was inconvenient to have game window in top left corner (otherwise videos won't be fully visible). 

So I've switched to my cheapiest windows 10 tablet (about 80$). And it was really good mobile experience. Near native resolution in portrait mode and touch input works perfect. Also I was able to play it wherever I want.


[b]Graphics[/b]: I like it. Backgrounds are always atmospheric. Some of them look really fascinating. 3D models are OK, visual effects do a good job of embedding 3d models into 2d background (cast of shadows, ambient illumination).

[b]Sound[/b] is good in all aspects.

[b]Gameplay[/b]: everything about dialogs and interaction with world is OK. But in "Dreamfall: TLJ" gameplay has developed in right direction.

[b]Overall[/b]: 9/10. -1 point for inobvious puzzless at some chapters.

40893067.review:
Un pur jeux d'Aventure Point and Click, assez vieux certe, il faut avouer que les graphismes on asser mal vieilli, et les cinématiques sont... Bah elle sont la quoi et c'est déja bien! Mais la pate artistique de ce jeux est vraiment une perle, mélant l'héroique fantaisie et le style Sci-Fi par della un lore asser bien fichu, l'histoire se laisse savourer tranquillement.
Pas de game over possible, il faut juste se triffouiller le ciboulot pour avancer, trouver des objets, les combiner, les utiliser et rebellote, tout suivant une narration doublée au petit oignon pour l'époque! (Et même encore aujourd'hui).

Asser bonne durée de vie, (Il m'a fallut environ 24h pour le boucler alors que je me rappellais des enigmes exepter certaine) le jeux laisse entrevoir ses suites (Dreamfall et Dreamfall Chapter) pour ceux qui ont vraiment accrocher au Lore du jeux.

Avis au amateur de Point and Click : Ce jeux est un bijoux.

40582909.review:
Voy a ser sincero: en las condiciones que se encuentra, mi consejo es que no compres The Longest Journey. ¿Por qué? Sencillamente porque es un juego que sólo te va a dar problemas:

- Sólo se puede ejecutar a pantalla completa en 640 x 480
- Desactiva la configuración "ClearType" de Windows
- No funciona el diálogo para salir del juego
- Tiene un uso de CPU exagerado para un juego de 1999 (60% en un i5 a 3700 MHz con 4 núcleos)
- Aunque para mí el inglés no es problema, si no tienes un nivel correcto, te pierdes casi todo el juego

En su día, hace 16 años, disfruté mucho con la versión de FX, en perfecto castellano, tanto voces como textos. Por entonces tenía un Pentium II a 566 MHz y gráfica de 2 MB de RAM, y el juego me iba a las mil maravillas. Pero hoy en día, se puede decir que no es posible jugar a The Longest Journey sin tener que instalar software de terceros para poder incrementar la resolución, jugar en modo ventana o tener el juego en español. Sí, es un gran juego, pero pierde tanto en los PCs modernos, que casi podría decir que, así, no hay forma de disfrutar de toda la historia.

Por mi parte, prefiero mantener el recuerdo de mis aventuras de April Ryan en el 2002 a tener que lidiar con todos los problemas que acarrea este juego en mi actual PC.

40450513.review:
Even by 2017, The Longest Journey is just one of those games that will never feel outdated to me. While the graphics are rather out-of-date, there is scenery and scenes in this game that are absolutely BEAUTIFUL for a game made back in 1998.

The game has an interesting premise, and while I finds some of the plot to be ludicrous, there's something about its absurdism that I just relish. Set in two worlds: The cyberpunk, futuresque, quasi-dystopian world of Stark, and the surreal, dream-like, magic-based world of Arcadia, The Longest Journey is definitely the product of those with an avid, wandering imagination. 

The voice-acting is excellent (even to this day), and I found myself getting attached to a plethora of the characters. While this game is charming and pretty fun, there's an eerie prescience underlying it all that creeps upon you the farther you get into the game. This is not a horror game by any means, but that doesn't mean it never indulges in the bizarre and the creepy. Trust me, it happens quite a bit...and in a semblance of equilibrium, it also delves into quests with tones of hilarity and joy as well. 

This is truly a wonderful game. Some games age terribly with time, but this is not one of them.

40255281.review:
Questo gioco ha dei difetti:
-ritmo lentissimo, vi troverete a fare avanti indietro o gli stessi dialoghi più e più volte.
-grafica superata: i personaggi sono giusto qualche poligono e poco più
-sfondi statici, a volte strapieni di oggetti e a volte completamente vuoti
-lingua solo inglese e tantissimi dialoghi lunghi (ma lenti quindi capibili)

Se sapete passare sopra a tutto ciò e volete una bella storia lo consiglio.
Io ho trovato qualche difficoltà perchè a volte il gioco vi fa prendere un oggetto in uno scenario e ve lo fa usare da un'altra parte anche varie ore dopo; molti utilizzi degli oggetti che si trovano non sono intuitivi e spesso si resta bloccati perchè non si è cercato esattamente in ogni posto di ogni scena; oppure magari capite anche quello che dovete fare ma non il modo per riuscirci. Inoltre nel menù restano degli oggetti che trovate all'inizio ma che non vengono usati e vanno a fare confusione!
Io per ora penso di essere a un terzo del gioco e i dialoghi stanno diventando quasi insostenibili, ma voglio continuarlo per la storia e soprattutto il carattere della protagonista.

Una cosa davvero bella sono le animazioni dei personaggi: non ne fanno più così con amore, siamo abituati a npc fermi che non fanno niente nello scenario.

Io l'ho preso in sconto nel pacchetto con tutta la trilogia a 18€ e lo sto continuando per arrivare a giocare quello più recente; quindi lo consiglio ma solo se siete consapevoli di tutta sta roba, altrimenti lasciate stare :)

8 out of 10.

The Longest Journey is very big and epic adventure game. 
The plot is might not be that original and the ending leaves a lot of questions unasked, but colorful characters, great dialogues and superb voice acting make the story much more amazing than it might look on paper. Graphics are very outdated, but prerendered backgrounds are still gorgeous and imaginative. Backtracking is a bit too slow because of the scale of the world, but it's not that big of a deal. 

Overall, The Longest Journey is very memorable experience and worth playing even today, 18 years since its release.

39986359.review:
Восхитительная прекрасная сказка, о сплетении двух миров киберпанк-будущего и фэнтези-прошлого. Удивительный купаж высоких технологий и мифических существ. Прекрасно реализована, осмыслена и великолепно озвучена. Интересные, пусть и не без вопросов и занудства, головоломки, добротная затягивающая история, очень хорошие персонажи и живой юмор заставляют возвращаться к Эйприл Райен вновь и вновь. Конечно, игра постарела за без малого 20 лет - и point-n-click в классическом виде давно уже вымирающий вид, и проблемы в работе на современных системах преследуют постоянно, но это стоит того, чтобы потерпеть.

The Longest Journey - эталонная в жанре, в способах повествования, вообще в принципах и подходах в рассказе истории, в проработке персонажей и вселенной… во всём. Создать целый мир, оживить его, вдохнуть жизнь в персонажей при таких скудных возможностях 99 года — это действительно талант и настоящее искусство.

39847975.review: It's difficult to recommend this one... It's very outdated and you must have a lot of patience and dedication to play this one through. Some of the puzzles are completely illogical, like when you have to combine everything with everything until you solve it. Sometimes you have to move your mouse around the screen over and over again until you get hover over something that you need and the cursor changes, because it just blends in with the environment. 39845965.review:
The Longest Journey is a game, which is somewhat difficult to review in 2018. On a surface it's a classic 90s point & click adventure with a significantly dated visuals. It is pain to run TLJ properly on modern systems, so you'll need to check some guides and do some modding to be able to play it. Gameplay-wise you'll encounter a lot of backtracking, rather slow pacing and some counter logical puzzles. The Longest Journey is not just a name of the game – it's really a long one. It took me 16 hours playing everything with a walkthrough. If you choose to play on your own you can easily make your journey 2-3X longer than mine. 

After all this you could wonder why it's worth playing in the first place? The thing is The Longest Journey is truly a gem in a lot of ways, if you can overcome its shortcomings. I was really surprised with quality of writing – choice of words, structure of sentences, rhythm – it's all absolutely great, and somewhat unexpected from non-native writer, but Ragnar Tornquist did an excellent job. Plot itself is a very beautiful fairy tale with well-crafted characters, witty jokes and beautiful, contrasting settings. Another exceptional part of this game is voice-acting. All the actors did great, but Sarah Hamilton, who voiced the protagonist, did something on entirely different level. It's really difficult for me to recall any other title which has voice-acting on par with this game, despite budgets in industry grew substantially in almost 20 years since release of TLJ. Honestly, it's worth playing just to hear beautiful voices reading beautifully written lines of text.

If you appreciate a good story and aren't afraid of huge amounts of text in your games, you absolutely should play The Longest Journey. I'm sure you'll fall in love with it. Just consider my advice and don't shy from using a walkthrough – don't let the sloppy parts of gameplay to halt you on one of the best journeys in the gaming. It's already a long one!

39371805.review: Despite looking and feeling really really dated, this game is amazing in its own way. The world it builds up is incredible, the characters are memorable and the story is very interesting!  April is a great heroine and I love her dearly. I loved the voice acting and the humour and there is lots and lots of talking so it has to be good. The narrative is pretty good too, I only felt sometimes that it's a bit rushed. When it's not talking to various NPCs, it is puzzle-time! There are a few frustrating ones, mainly at the beginning and that scared me a bit, but they are mostly enjoyable after that, if you get a feel for the environment (very good environments too!) and the types of actions that the game expects from you. So yeah, it's a fun time, if you are patient with it, let yourself immerse in it and are not afraid to overlook the limitations of the graphics and the engine.

39345650.review:
I'm recommending this... but with caveats.
The graphics haven't aged all that well and as far as gameplay a certain level of patience is needed as the game expects (if not requires) you to amble through all the dialog options (and they are many and long), sometimes (irritatingly) including the *I wasn't listening can you please repeat that important bit to me again* option wherein the NPC will suddenly discover new information that they can add. Oh and some of the puzzles are annoying.

That aside though the main reason to play this is for the story. It's good as a stand alone piece but it is also the first in a series of games and very much recommended if you want to follow the story all the way through. I remember loving the concept and getting lost in the story the first time I played it, and even coming back to it now - years later, it sucked me back in again.

Probably also worth mentioning this is not a game aimed at kids due to language, content and themes.

39308599.review:
Credo che sia una delle avventure grafiche più belle a cui abbia mai giocato. Già dal nome del titolo, si capisce che questo titolo sarà piuttosto lungo ed è quello che mi è piaciuto. La storia è ambientata nel futuro e ruota attorno ad una ragazza di nome April Ryan, la quale scopre di avere il potere di viaggiare attraverso due mondi: Stark che rappresenta la terra dove regna la scienza (e dove vive April) e Arcadia, un mondo dove regna la magia. Il guardiano dell'equilibrio è scomparso e a causa di questo la magia di Arcadia si sta riversando su Stark, rendendo l'equilibrio instabile. April dovrà cercare di mettere le cose a posto e di ristabilire l'equilibrio. 
 Il gioco è un punta e clicca e c'è da leggere... Molto. Oltretutto, i posti dove cercare e usare gli oggetti non sono scontati, bisogna avere un occhio di falco e mettere il puntatore ovunque per vedere quale interazioni possono esserci. Anche nei dialoghi bisogna parlare molto con gli altri personaggi per andare avanti, quindi è importante esplorare tutte le risposte anche quelle non importanti (nel caso, saprete molto di più sulla storia!). Cosa molto utile è che tutti i dialoghi vengono trascritti nel diario di April, così se vi perdete qualcosa o vi dimenticate qualcosa aprite il diario e lo trovate là ;)
 Interessante anche lo spazio dei pensieri di April, dove potrete leggere tutti gli avvenimenti della ragazza prima dell'avventura (e quindi scoprire un po' i retroscena della protagonista). I personaggi sono caratterizzati moltissimo e non manca neanche la comicità! Se la grafica non è un problema (è del 1999 il gioco) vi consiglio di comprarlo!

39252622.review:
Игра, которую я не могу просто пройти стороной и оставить без внимания. Именно благодаря этой игре и великолепной Сибири я полюбила игры данного жанра. 
Вновь приобретя игру, я с огромным удовольствием погрузилась в этот мир и пережила заново все события вместе с Эйприл Райан, насладилась диалогами и вспомнила всех тех персонажей, которые меня неприятно муражили или наоборот, мне ипонировали. 
Эта история, со всеми последующими частями заслуживает 100 из 10 однозначно. 
Теперь, пройдя эту игру вновь, приступлю к следующим частям. 
Эта история надолго останется в ваших сердцах, так же, как и в моем. 
С детства я ждала продолжения, после, вспоминала, как рыдала в конце второй части, переживала за Зои..и сейчас, спустя столько лет, отметив свой день рождения «20+» я вновь возвращаюсь в Ньюпорт, Аркадию, встречаюсь с любимым, харизматичным, веселым вороном и «писию кипятком» от радости. 
Эта игра - действительно начало бесконечного путешествия.

39231226.review:
( Le jeu est marqué Full Anglais sur steam, mais il existe un Patch FR Voix et Texte très simple à installer dans l'onglet "Guides de la communauté)

The Longest Journey est un jeu Point 'n' click d'aventure où l'on contrôle April Ryan, étudiante banale en art, qui découvre qu'elle a le pouvoir de voyager entre les 2 mondes, un dédié à la logique et la science (le nôtre) et un autre dédié à la magie.

Hormis les graphismes et les animations de l'époque, ce jeu est très bon. Le scénario est excellent avec quelques rebondissements, les persos attachants, et le contraste magie/science est très sympa. Et la fin donne envie de connaître la suite.

La narration, par contre, est très lente, et les personnages qui parlent lentement n'aident pas. J'ai passé plusieurs fois les dialogues en lisant les sous-titres au lieu d'écouter. Peut-être que les désactiver facilite l'immersion ?

Le gameplay est basique. Vous cliquez sur des objets et une petite interface s'affiche pour choisir l'action à faire sur l'objet/personnage.

Les énigmes sont parfois farfelues et compliquées, j'ai du chercher sur le net pas mal de fois, mais le journal qu'April entretient contient des indices sur les choses à faire heureusement.

Le doublage est plutôt bon, si ce n'est des attentes longues entre chaque dialogue. 

Le jeu est malheureusement ancien (1999) et donc pas adapté à Windows 10. Il existe des guides pour le faire tourner correctement sur Windows 10 et dans une bonne résolution même si des bugs graphiques comme la souris qui laisse des points blancs sur l'écran, tout comme les sous-titres. 
Guide Win10:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/6310/discussions/0/358415206086612808/
Guide Haute Résolution:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/6310/discussions/0/360671727315656616/

Bref, The Longest Journey est un jeu à faire pour les amateurs de PnC ou d'histoire narratives. J'ai hâte de jouer aux deux derniers opus, Dreamfall et Dreamfall: Chapters.

39213429.review:
I played this game with my dad and sister many years ago. We'd stay up really late on my dad's computer working together to solve the puzzles.

I was excited to get it on steam but unfortunately it doesn't play right on my computer. The arrow keeps disappearing so I can't check the options, and so I have to force my computer to exit and shut down in order to get rid of the game.

However, I do recommend this game if you like click-and-play puzzle gameplay. The story has a lot of depth, and the puzzles require a lot of creativity and ingenius thinking. The only flaw I know is that the characters do a lot of talking. And I mean a LOT. However, it is a more accurate reflection of conversation.

38476974.review:
I'd heard great things about The Longest Journey, so I got it on sale and decided to settle in and get ready for what I expected to ben an incredible story and challenging point-and-click adventure.  I want to state that I am an avid and proud classic gamer.  I have an embarassing amount of classic gaming gear in my closet of shame, and I fully appreciate classic games of all genres.  I've played many classic point and click games, and I'm aware of how the genre has evolved over time.  That is why I was surprised at how disappointed I was with playing The Longest Journey for the first time in 2017.  

The game's dialog seemed forced - as in they literally force you to sit through all branches of the conversation tree (with ALL NPCs), and you better do it or you'll miss out on some info that lets you continue the adventure.  Seriously, there is so much exposition in this game, you'd think it was an exhibit at the 1999 World's Fair (if there was one).

The puzzles were either too easy or completely ridiculous.  You'll see other reviewers complain about the "Rubber Ducky" puzzle, and they should.  It was a masterpiece of communicating to me that this game hates me.

The voice acting might have been good for 1999, but now it is only passable on average and unbearable at times.  The guy who did the Slingblade impersonation made me think about switching to subtitles only!

I didn't connect with April (the main character).  There was something about the character that just seemed too young and inexperienced to be relateable.  Then I found this wonderful review which helped me identify what my problem was: 
 https://www.popmatters.com/193427-the-longest-journey-makes-clear-a-good-story-is-not-timeless-2495531946.html

In case you don't want to read that article, the basic idea is that games have gotten really good at being serious.  Mass Effect, Bioshock, Batman, Skyrim, The Witcher and a ton of Indy titles have accepted the challenge to deliver a compelling and inspirational story, but in 1999 that wasn't the case.  As a result, the almost self-mocking tone that TLJ takes comes off as overly apologetic and holds the player back from truly identifying with the characters.

Finally, I literally fell asleep during every extended playing session with this game.  That is probably mostly my fault, but I just couldn't take it anymore and had to quit.  If the game still came on CDs, I think I would have made it to somewhere in disk 2, but that was enough for me.  I cannot recommend The Longest Journey to my friends or anyone unless maybe it is the first story driven adventure game you'll ever play.

38435084.review:
Eines der besten... wenn nicht sogar das beste "Point & Click" Adventure überhaupt. "The Longest Journey" ist ein Science Fiction/Fantasy Mix, welcher den Spieler von Anfang an in seinen Bann zieht. Seit dem letzten mal, als ich das Spiel 2001 mit Begeisterung gespielt habe, hat es auch Heute nichts von seiner Faszination verloren. Die Grafiken sehen trotz geringer Auflösung immer noch sehr schön aus. Es besitzt eine für damalige Zeiten sehr gute Deutsche Synchronisation (welche es bei der Steam Version aber leider mal wieder nicht gibt, also Sprachpatch suchen.). Die Dialoge haben viel Witz und sind sehr gut geschrieben. Alle Rätsel sind absolut nachvollziehbar, und man jagt auch nicht stundenlang nach Pixelgroßen Gegenständen her, wie es zum Beispiel bei der "Runaway" Serie der Fall ist. Man könnte fast sagen... das Spiel ist nahezu Perfekt. Die Story ist intensiv und spannend. Man leidet richtig mit "April Ryan" auf ihrer langen Reise mit. 17 Stunden habe ich gebraucht, und damit hat das Spiel eine gute Spielzeit.

Jeder der es noch nicht kennt, und gerne "Point & Click" Adventures spielt, sollte dieses Meisterwerk unbedingt nachholen.

38423295.review:
Review In Progress and Not Final:

Recently I decided to see if I could try the trilogy out, just to see if it was even possible for me, this was a total pure clean slate run with no history with the series, no lore known, no story known, no secrets, only that I know vaguely of April and of Zoe and that Chapters took a long time to make in order to finish the series in some meaningful way.
Anyway I fire up the game, and quit-out 10 mins later in utter frustration at what can only be described as the worst point and click adventure game I have ever encountered in my gaming history. No hints, tips, help, guides or advice of ANY kind can be found in the game, you are literally stuck trying to figure out the first of presumeably many puzzles in this so-called award-winning, critically acclaimed game...which it's not...in any way/shape/form and those defending this game are outright liars for not seeing it's flaws and mistakes.

Now the music is good, the voiceover work is fantastic given back around 1999/2000 VO work was extremely rare in video games and almost never done, however the storyline/plot will leave you confused as hell and even on that 1st screen I have no idea what's going on. You have to redirect some waterfall to help a tree that in turn will save an egg for some giant phoenix type bird and I can only assume you get to move on from this, but my brain was hurting just trying to figure out how you re-direct the water with the stick you found. Cue the rage quit.

Now you can argue this is only the start and yes that's true, however I watched some YT videos /wo spoilers and they do state the game has several puzzles that require logical thinking to solve, which is fine...IF the game had proven more helpful, but you get nothing, and bare in mind yes nowadays you can find the answers online, however:

1. If this had been 1999/2000 early internet would NOT have given answers so you lot would have been just as stuck if your a veteran of this series so you should understand my anger
2. I had ZERO interest in cheating my way through this game with help guides, I was expecting it to be enter game, play through story, work my way through the trilogy, it's all done, game was flawless, no issues, but this is not the case

A good game will ease you in, help you settle into the game and progress through it, TLJ does not accomodate for this and your first few mins with a game really factors into whether you will like/enjoy that game or not and games that don't help you out when they should (especially in RPG types) really let themselves down in that regard.

I cannot recommend TLJ to either new or old players, the repeating VO text from clicking and zero help on any of the puzzles is too mentally detrimental for the game to win you over and succeed in immersing you into it's world.

38191905.review:
TLDR: Old fashioned point and click with awesome storytelling on a huge, multi-world scale definitely holds up 18 years later.

My husband and I recently got addicted to VR and have been fairly desperate for a brand new computer with all the bells and whistles.  That said, my decision to pursue a graduate education has left us penniless for the time being.  One night, the gaming bug bit me particularly hard after seeing some of the puzzle/adventure PSVR releases that have just come out, and I rather desolately fired up the 7 year old laptop that occupies space under my bed, hoping to find something on steam that it could run (generally hit or miss, with more miss than hit) and could also be entertaining enough to occupy my time.  I knew that with the graphics being as bad as they were, something point-and-click would probably be the best.

I found this game on a list called 100 best point and click adventure games or something like that.  It was $10, so if it only brought me a few hours of middling entertainment, it was probably a decent value.

Wow.  It's now two days later.  I have done nothing in my free time except play this game, despite the fact that I am in my last week of grad school and I literally have the final exams that will make or break my graduation in two days.  I can't help it--it's really well done, with very tricky puzzles (I am a dedicated puzzle gamer, artifex mundi, myst, name it) that really had you trying just about everything, tons of lore from a bunch of different races, and cutscenes that while old, are really impressive and almost emotional in how cool some of the effects are.  I have no idea how many hours it took me to finish this game, but it is the kind of game that you really shouldn't start unless you have a few days free, because you probably won't be doing anything else for a while. 

If this is any indication, I see that there are two sequels, but I am purposely NOT going to buy them until after finals, because if I fail my finals because I was playing computer games, my husband is going to be so pissed.  It's really, really hard to resist though!

38188920.review:
Suitably epic, immersive, unforgettable.  8/10

It's not perfect, but it really is fun. Some puzzle design needed revisiting and some scenes pull the player out of the world, but these are more like distractions to an otherwise lovingly crafted game. Strong voice acting makes already likable characters even more compelling. Most of the puzzles are logical and straightforward and rarely require outside help. I'm glad I played this game, and I'm glad I finally beat it: it's a very satisfying check to add to the classic point-and-click list. 

Again, it's unpolished at points (80% of the puzzles, voice acting, and scenes are great; the other 20% can be grating) but the good strongly outweighs the bad. The pacing of the story is questionable (slow start, steady and exciting middle with occasional bumps, hyper-fast ending) but it's compelling and immersive enough throughout. 

Highly recommended, albeit with advice: be patient, don't expect too much, and let yourself enjoy the journey.

37961422.review:
Свершилось, я познакомилась с легендарным The Longest Journey! В детстве не играла, потом пыталась, но у меня была непроходимая багованная версия, и вот наконец-то и возможность, и повод появились пройти игру целиком. Сложно оценивать ее сейчас, тем более, что опыт прохождения был специфический: полностью по проходилке, иначе это заняло бы у меня долбанную вечность. Квест действительно очень качественный, особенно для конца девяностых (просто не верится, что он вышел так давно). И все же бешеного восторга и желания поставить игре высший балл у меня нет (хотя впервые пройденному в этом году The Dig я без колебаний дала десятку).

Очевидные плюсы квеста:
- Проработанная фантастическая история, действительно большой и интересный сюжет
 - Сочетание двух миров, фэнтези и фантастики, в одной игре
 - Хорошие, интересные персонажи, включая и главную героиню
 - Есть забавные ситуации, которые оживляют прохождение
 - Кинематографичность: героиня перемещается по городу на метро, а не телепортируется неизвестным способом, локации правдоподобного размера, иногда героиня ложится отдохнуть, а не бегает без устали по локациям, ни разу не присев, пока вокруг что-то происходит
 - Атмосферно, в историю погружаешься с головой, в игре много сюжетных поворотов, которые держат в тонусе
 - Красивые локации, запоминающиеся моменты, в общем, игра не выветривается из памяти бесследно
 - Есть очень крутая русификация игры, перевод с озвучкой высшего качества.

Субъективные минусы, за которые фанаты меня проклянут:
 - Есть слишком замороченные загадки
 - Как я поняла, есть варианты, когда прохождение заходит в тупик (например, с глазом у игрушки)
 - Беготня по локациям, которые нужно просто пройти мимо, начинает в какой-то момент надоедать, даже с учетом возможности быстрого перемещения по двойному клику
 - Иногда на голову игроку вываливают слишком много информации. Все-таки когда нужно полчаса слушать диалог с одним персонажем или прочитать 20 страниц разных книжек – это перебор.
 - И в целом ощущение, что приключение не просто самое длинное, а слишком длинное. Даже по проходилке это заняло дофига времени (больше, чем показывает стим – из-за технических сложностей пришлось играть в другую версию). И под конец история начала меня утомлять. Напомнило какой-то гигантский сериал, в котором сюжет все наслаивается и наслаивается, и конца-края тому не видно. Я бы сказала, что Longest Journey – это квест с масштабом AAA-РПГ проекта и сюжетом полноценного фантастического романа. Звучит как комплимент, но по-моему, это отнюдь не однозначно плюс. Все же у каждого жанра своя специфика. По-моему, истории Longest Journey в своем жанре оказалось тесно.

7/10, но, безусловно, пройти ее стоит, особенно любителям жанра.

37837992.review:
To all those considering buying this lil game of 1999, a fair warning: this game is part an annoyance, and part what my sharp humour and nostalgic reference-loving heart desires most. Would I recommend this game wholeheartedly? Not unless you have a computer near completely compatible with its aged requirements, like a non-Nvidia graphics card (unless its like five generations old). So let's say I recommended it most-heartedly.

The annoyance comes from the obnoxious outdated standards the game comes with, and the fact that even though there are working fixes for some issues they decrease the quality of graphics - like activating software mode to rid my screen of the flickering. The biggest pain though comes with my desktop - which is probably best fit for games around 2014, lets be honest - displaying flickering textures upon character movement, and having no conclusive fix. So, in total, this game is perfect for my laptop save the software mode activation but unplayable on any relatively up to date system.

It's a shame that no further fixes or patches are available, as this game is truly an experience worth exploring; this simple point 'n' click puzzle game holds more engaging humour and story within it than near all new games, especially AAA games. Also it's arguably more progressive in ways. Of the series, this game I feel is the most story rich and the least likely to bore you, with interesting encounters, characters, places and dialogue options. Sure, it has a one or two clichés but what game doesn't? I think this game will be one of my favourites for a long time coming, certainly worth the play.

But don't take my word for it, buy it - on sale if you're as uncertain as I was - and give it a go.

I first got this game from my aunt back in 1999.
She worked at Funcom as something I can't remember and she gave me a copy.

Four CDs of point-n-clicky magic. Four CDs that would introduce me to a game it took me almost 12 years to finish.
I unfortunately lost those CDs in the chaos of moving several times throughout my life and it eventually disappeared from my mind.

Then, one fateful morning, I found it on Steam. Faster than I'm in bed I bought it and started playing it again. It was like having sex for the first time in years. The itch of "not quite good enough puzzles" was gone and my life had purpose again.

Pros:
-Story rich. If story was money this would be the richest motherfucker on the planet.

-Puzzles for days. You like Silent Hill and Monkey Island kinds of puzzles? This game puts them in a choke hold and makes love to them. Those puzzles are bitches compared to these.

-Amazing worlds. If Elder Scrolls had any brains they'd steal some ideas off of this game. Amazing.

-Sexyness. You know that girl/guy you like? The one with the great body and great personality who's great with his/her parents and is the ideal life-partner? He/she is an abuse spouse compared to The Longest Journey.

Cons:

This game has aged, and you can tell from the screenshots alone, and with games as old as this you can defiantly expect bugs, but this game has charm, wit and a very shall we say an...eccentric cast of characters and i adore all of them.

The story is a roller coaster of fantasticly detailed worlds and lore which is so large in scope for a game published in the late 90's, one minute you're strolling through a sci-fi dystopia of what looks like a product placement wonderland, the next you're actually in a wonderland of forest's and castles, magic and creatures.

One minute you're hanging out in a coffee shop that you waitress where you talk with your best pals about the hard life of being art students in a polluted but covered in tech 'New Venice' which is so hilariously a sci-fi 'Friends' you can't help but be laugh and get attached and then next you're chillin' with a monk whos explaining to you how the universe works.

The whole experience of this game is so singular that its singularness is enough of a reason to check it out, but the game is also just great point and click adventure fun.

10/10 would save a dragons egg and the entire universe again.

36454842.review:
What I want to note from the beginning - this journey is reeaaally long. You play and you think: "Wow, that must be it, the final chapter", but no, there's more and more. It's an amazing, quite detailed and interesting story, and since I play the games only for a good plot, I tell you: buy it! I strongly recommend it instead of annoying romance books and superheroes-themed garbage.

The strange thing is the age of this game. There is a lot of humour here (I literally laughed out loud, and those notes in the diary...), mostly about cliches of fantasy. The main heroine is a funny sarcastic girl, but look, I thought you'd want to be sarcastic about standart plot twists now, in 2017, but...not, like, 20 years ago. There were no such amazing games, for god's sake, to annoy people with their predictability! It's almost like the scenarist is a time traveller!

I don't know though why this game feels so fresh. I've read many books, played many games and watched lots of movies, but this one... is nothing I've heard of. Yeah, sure, it has a lot of standart fantasy things like magical races, dark woods, prophecies, good and evil sides, but there are so much more sudden development twists, and it's sooooo very interesting that I couldn't get away from the game! I really wish I could erase my memory and play it once again. The atmosphere in general felt really nice, that cyberpunk here and fantasy there... There certainly could be done something to make it even better, but still the atmoshere is really high-level, the scenarist did a great job to dip us into his story.

And a female protagonist, how few of them exist! What a wonderful feeling I had while watching April go through all the troubles she had, all the adventures, and how she trolled that captain of the ship… Also, lesbian side couple. No comments, just thanks!

Aside from my delight about the story, there are gameplay, riddles, graphics, sound and one little thing more. All that keeping in mind the age of this game.

The gameplay is not very convenient, even kinda buggish? There will be some places where you'll need to go back to get a forgotten toy, to do something unobvious or the plot won't move any further and so on. There are scenes where you can't skip NPCs' slow walking (library...), where you can't properly click on something. Then again - 1999.

The riddles are fine in general. Not very difficult, most of them are quite logical... But in some places to move forward was impossible without a walkthough. Well, maybe I'm not that smart, but I just had to note it.

The graphics is, well... Okay. For a 1999 at least. Probably. You certanly will be surprised that Cortez is an old man when April will mention it... But you know, it's worth playing, despite the graphics. It's just so really good.

The sound is amazing. Very beautiful and atmospheric music will accompany your mood through the story. The voice acting is great as well, I fell in love with April the moment I heard her first sarcastic comment!

Now what really bugs me after the end is the lesson of this story. Just what did the author want to tell us? There can't be a story without a lesson, but here I can't really understand it. Help your friends? Not really. Love your family? Nah. Be ready to sacrifice yourself, to admit your destiny? I wouldn't say so. Be brave? Be kind? I don't know! That remained a mystery for me. As well as the personality of the side characters. And in the end April, her character didn't really change. Or maybe it did, but we don't exactly know it, since the game ends so abruptly. And leaves so many questions without a near-future answer...

I certainly will play the Dreamfall. And I will cherish the hope for the continuation of this beautiful story and my longest journey.

UPDATE: Well, I greatly regret the decision to play Dreamfall from the bottom of my heart. That was one of the biggest mistakes in my life.

35648416.review:
This game is a great vision with really crappy implementation, and I don't just say that because it's old. The puzzles in this game are obnoxiously nonsensical, and teh story starts off good, but becomes boring. 

If you're checking this out because dreamfall chapters caught your eye, my suggestion would be to skip this one and start with either the 2nd or 3rd game. It is worth noting that you won't be missing any important backstory by skipping this one -- in fact there are some plot points that seem contradictory between this and the 2nd, (although I haven't finished the 3rd yet, so perhaps they bring them write around the inconsistancies later)

(there's some overlap in the names, so to be clear: 1st is longest journey, 2nd is longest journey: dreamfall, 3rd is dreamfall chapters)

The story is interesting at first, but without any real events in the middle. It's like they had an idea for a good 3 hour game with the prototypical urban fantasy story: Girl is whisked away to another world, finds she has magic powers, goes on quest to retrieve magic artifact, and eventually saves the world. And honestly, that part is fairly good, (aside from the obtuse puzzles)

Except it's like they decided to make it super long by having a dozen artifacts instead of just a few, but then ran out of budget and just tore through the rest of the game. The first 3 chapters took a few hours each, and were just to get oriented to the new world. I think you're like 6 hours in, around chapter 5 when you get your first artifact. By chapter 8ish, you're like 15 hours in with maybe 3 artifacts. Now near the end, they just throw them at you. There's a chapter that's just a 3 minute cutscene where you get like 3 artifacts. It's highly uneven. 

The voice acting was pretty good i thought, and the characters were likable. Interactions with the comic sidekick were certainly amusing and provided laughs without distracting or becoming annoying. The story certainly felt epic at times, although the ending was so rushed it wasn't any good. 

Lots to like about this game, but the epic story at first with the overly long middle and rushed end was just frustrating for me. Add that to being a point n click with nonsensical puzzles, and it's just a pain.

35582641.review:
¡¡¡OJO!!! EN MI OPINIÓN, ES UN JUEGO DE CULTO, por complejidad en la trama, gráficos, puzzles bien pensados (aunque no todos), duración, y lo más importante AÑO DE CREACIÓN DE ESTE JUEGO Y ACOGIDA.

Sinceramente... pocas personas conocen este juego, porque sólamente lo saben los que lo jugaron en su época y actualmente son personas que no juegan a videojuegos y apenas se acordarán...

La sociedad y niños actuales no tendrán ni pu... idea de este tipo de juegos y la relevancia que tuvo éste. Básicamente... ES EL PADRE DEL POINT & CLICK (ADEMÁS DE PUZZLES).

--------------------------------------------

Juego de mi infancia que nunca logré acabar por la complejidad de algunos de los puzzles dados. Y que ahora al crecer tengo más intelecto que cuando tenía 7 años...

Una historia inmersiva, atrapante y enredada en la que unirás las piezas del rompecabezas del guión poco a poco...

Prácticamente este fue uno de los primeros videojuegos en la que ha tenido protagonista femenino de forma absoluta.

Protagonista bien diseñada y planteada. Los demás personajes... mmm... podrían habérselo currado más, pero es pasable.

Un final en la que nadie se esperaría (para mí, ahora... ha sido un final que me esperaba capítulos antes de dicho final... como he dicho "une bien las piezas y lo entenderás" y entendí casi todo menos una cosa, el personaje de Cortés, me pilló por sorpresa, aunque es entendible)

Una compra recomendadísima y sinceramente... actualmente está el juego caro, antes se conseguía prácticamente gratis gracias a la desarrolladora FX Interactive.

-------------------------------------

Aquí digo los contras:

*Actualmente este juego y saga ha caído en el olvido (ERROR y culpa garrafal de esta sociedad en la que se autodenominan gamers...) PD: entiendo que puede haber personas que no sepan algunos juegos anteriores por el nombre o cosas así, pero que sean muchas personas... ya no.

*Es una historia divertida, pero hay partes que exageran la gracia y si en tu mente escuchas grillos... es normal.

*Puzzles complicados porque hay veces que no te dicen lo que tienes que hacer, ni te dan pistas, dejándolo al aire, y si por ejemplo te has saltado un diálogo que no veías importante porque no lo es a simple vista... no te dejarán hacer un acción esencial, aunque sea una tontería de nada. Como coger un tornillo (es un ejemplo, no hay nada de eso en la historia). Por eso muchas veces tienes que tener en mano una guía para verificar si te has saltado algo.

*Hay un personaje que se ha mencionado mucho y que apenas se ha visto en el juego, y me he sentido el vacío de no haber podido hablar con dicho personaje, no es esencial, pero era alguien más en el complejo de apartamentos donde empieza la historia.

---------------------------------

En fin, recomiendo su compra, pero si lo veis caro... lo siento, nunca he visto este juego al 75% de descuento, solo al 66% aún así, comprarlo y sus secuelas.

35530382.review:
I didnt play The Longest Journey when it came out, so it is new to me.  Im about halfway through and I can honestly say I like it.  However, I do not love it.  I know some rank TLJ as one of the best adventure games ever...Personally, I would not.  Its a solid "good," not "great."  

It has decent voice acting, which is present throughout the entire game (thus far).  Some of the speech goes on for a long time and I found it myself reading the text and skipping through the speech to move things along.   Some of the voice acting  is a little cheesey, but for the most part, it is solid.  The story is derivative and brings nothing new or exciting.  However, even though it is unoriginal, it is presented well.  There isnt much in the way of music or sound effects that stand out, which is both a positive and a negative.  Graphically, the game is playable on a modern high resolution monitor.  It doesnt look great, but it is definitely passable.  The graphical models low polygon count definitely show the games age.  And the backgrounds seem to get washed out from being stretched to higher resolutions.  The interface is simple and easy to use.  Everything accessable from the mouse, which is nice.  There is no need to use a keyboard, unless you want to skip through the lengthy spoken dialog.  As I said before, its faster to read the subtitles.  Some of the animations while interacting with objects, especially people, are annoyingly long and unskippable.  This is especially annoying when you are trying to do something repeatedly.  Some of the puzzles are really simple and require no thought.  While some are a little more complex.  There is one puzzle in the game that is so ridiculously difficult that it is considered one of the hardest puzzles in adventure games.  This game definitely falls into the category of clicking inventory items and just seeing if they interact with what you are doing.  This game defintely has the failing of many adventure games, in that the solution is something you wouldnt think of.  You simply solved it by clicking inventory and interacting with the environment. 

Again, this game is good, but nowhere near the likes of other adventure games.  Still, for the cheap price, it is worth it if you like the genre.

Игра замечательная, особенно для квестомана и любителя Сибирии, управление в которой очень схоже. Как и жуткие лица персонажей, впрочем Х) TLJ увлекательна, интересна и полна греющих душу отсылок и самоиронии ("Загадочная дверь, через которую никто никогда не ходит. Будь я Нэнси Дрю, не смогла бы пройти мимо".), а графика, полагаю, на время выхода была потрясающа, сейчас же она очаровательна. Квесты интересные, хотя порой приходится лезть в прохождение, чтобы узнать, зачем на самом деле нужно кольцо (в жизни бы не догадался, на самом деле, разве что методом тыка) и что, оказывается, чайку нужно покормить, причём не швырнув в неё буханкой, а интеллигентно покрошив её вниз на уточку.
Но при всех плюсах игры есть один существенный минус для обладателей десятой винды (а может, и не только для них). Хотя сама игра идёт вполне нормально, при перезаписи старого сохранения или выходе из игры, когда выскакивает окно подтверждения, оно становится полностью белым, а курсор - неактивным. На enter оно реагирует, но выбирает по умолчанию ответ "нет", и, как говорится, на колу м.очало. Больше не реагирует ни на основные стрелки клавиатуры, ни на стрелки нампада, ни на табулятор, ни на попытки обтыкать мышью или тачпадом. Приходилось вырубать игру через диспетчер задач, что не есть приятно, и лишаться возможности перезаписывать сохранения, т.е. каким-то образом рассчитывать их количество на игру. Мелочь, вроде бы, а неприятно. Только лазанье по сообществу помогло узнать, что лечится это дело нажатием Y (спасибо добрым людям!).
Если опустить эти неприятности и тот факт, что "лица" персонажей могут сниться потом в кошмарах, можно вынести однозначный вердикт - мастплэй) Надеюсь, последующие части меня не разочаруют)
...Как это было с той же Сибирией. Но не будем о грустном.

34821834.review:
[b][u]5 Things You Should Know about [i]The Longest Journey[/i][/u][/b]
[b]What's Is It?[/b]
A classic point & click adventure game, first released in 1999.  The story concerns a young woman named April Ryan who discovers that she's instrumental in preventing a catastrophe that threatens the Balance between two worlds; Stark and Arcadia.

[b]What's The Best Part?[/b]
The story.  I wouldn't necessarily call it "original" these days, but it's thoughtful, moving and VERY well told.  It challenges some common tropes of the genre without denying their necessity.  The characters are also well-rounded.  April Ryan is the perfect example of what a female protagonist [i]should be,[/i] in my opinion.  She's not a damsel in distress, but neither is she an arse-kicking, hyper-sexualized, I-am-woman-hear-me-roar style character, the likes of which Hollywood (and many other video games) love to put forward under the label "strong female lead."  April has strengths and weaknesses, hopes and fears.  She has a realistic body type and she dresses in reasonable outfits.  She feels like a real person, which only makes you as a player identify that much more with her plight.

[b]What's The Worst Part?[/b]
The graphics were considered pretty good when the game first came out, but they have NOT aged well.  The game is still perfectly playable, but it shows its age.  Likewise, the voices.  Some of the voice actors really go all out, others not so much.  (Thankfully April herself is in the former category, since you'll be listening to her more than anyone else.)  In 1999, when the concept of having voices [i]at all[/i] was still a novelty, this could be overlooked.  Today, it takes its toll.

Also, with the Steam version, there's one significant bug: confirmation dialogs for [i]exiting the game[/i] or [i]overwriting saves[/i], etc do not display properly (at least on Windows)!  Press "Y" for "Yes" or "N" for "No" to get past these mysterious empty white boxes when they pop up.

[b]Will I Like It?[/b]
The Longest Journey is probably my favourite P&C adventure game of all time.  The story is the purpose for a game like this, and this story is worth experiencing, even if the audio/visuals are showing their age.  It's also the first installment in a trilogy which does not disappoint as it unfolds in full.

[i]Fair warning to parents:[/i] There is strong language in this game (multiple F-bombs) which you might not expect, given the presentation.  I don't personally find this offensive, but others might.

[b]Why Should I Buy It?[/b]
If you've read the review this far and are still considering it, buy this game!  You won't be disappointed.

This has been a 5TYSK review. (#0007)

IMPORTANT: This game had trouble starting on my Windows 7 (64-bit) PC. If I started my PC and tried to start the game, it would never start the first time, giving me a DirectDraw error, which also made my mouse cursor only work on half of my desktop, so I would have to ctrl-alt-del and log out from windows. BUT, when I would log back in to Windows and start the game again, it would work perfectly, every time. So, if you have the same problem, just start the game the first time when you don't have any other important applications running, hit ctrl-alt-del when you get the error, log out, log in and start it again. For whatever reason, that works. I don't know why.

34352497.review:
[h1]Genialer Mix aus Fantasy und Science-Fiction[/h1]

Normalerweise gehören Point-and-Click Adventures nicht zu meinem Spielerepertoire. Auf The Longest Journey bin ich gekommen, weil ich Dreamfall Chapters spielen wollte, aber von vielen Seiten hörte, dass die Geschichte kaum zu verstehen ist, wenn man die Vorgänger nicht kennt. Im Nachhinein schäme ich mich ein bisschen dafür, dass ich The Longest Journey nur spielen wollte, damit ich die Nachfolger verstehe.

Das Spiel erzählt eine unglaublich fantastische Geschichte, die mich oft an Fantasy-Bücher erinnerte, die ich in meiner Kindheit gelesen habe (z. B. Wolfgang Hohlbein, für alle die den Namen kennen :). Es geht dabei um ein übernatürliches Gleichgewicht von Wissenschaft und Magie, das zwischen den Paralleluniversen steht und deren Existenz sichert. Dieses ins Wanken gekommene Gleichgewicht gilt es wiederherzustellen und das bedeutet für den Spieler eine Reise in die verschiedensten Winkel beider Welten.
Dieses Gefüge und die Historie beider Welten sind an sich schon unglaublich interessant, aber dazu kommen noch unterschiedlichste sympathische Charaktere (abgesehen von der Hauptfigur April Ryan natürlich). Von lesbischen Vermietern eines Studentenwohnheims mit fragwürdigen sexuellen Vorlieben, einem flapsigen sprechenden Vogel als Sidekick, bis hin zu einem teuflischen Alchemisten, der in seiner fliegenden Festung den besten Pfefferminzkuchen aller Zeiten backt, ist wirklich alles dabei.

Was die Rätsel angeht, wäre ich ohne die gelegentliche Konsultierung der Komplettlösung vermutlich auf mehrere hundert Spielstunden gekommen, aber ich bin auch nicht besonders Fit darin. Im Nachhinein betrachtet sind die Rätsel aber (größtenteils) fair und sowieso sehr kreativ gestaltet.

The Longest Journey war eine Reise an die ich mich auf jeden Fall noch lange erinnern werde :D

34281787.review:
Being a fan of point and click adventures, there was little doubt I'd like the game. However the game differs quite a bit from your traditional adventure of the era. For once, Puzzles are a little bit rarer and more confined to certain areas of the game, making them more accessible. Also the game is skewed towards telling its story, so there is a bunch of lengthy conversations happening instead of puzzles all the time. Knowing this era only from puzzle-heavy titles like Monkey Island or Sam&Max, I really enjoyed this shift. Overall the gameplay feels quite slow, with a lot of running and listening involved.

Now as all point and click adventures, this game also suffers from the gamplay problem of being stuck. Sometimes you are bound to miss things or interpret situations differently from what the developers intended. Given the more straightforward and limited nature of the puzzles in this game, I found myself being significantly less stuck and able to keep a good pace through the game.

The story was really engaging for me. A nice mix of science fiction and classic fairy-tale fantasy made for some funny and likeable moments. Now the story isn't really anything out of the ordinary nowadays, but the way it is being told and the characters used made for a nice unique experience in my view, with a certain sidekick stealing the show. There is also a nice portion of geek culture references, so if you belong to the target audience, you get some more laughs out of it.

There's no way aroung it, the game looks old, having your standard run-of-the-mill prerendered Backgrounds with some live rendered foreground, as was common for the time. I didn't think any of the voice acting was particularly bad, but some of the voices really stood out from the crowd.

I can wholeheartedly recommend the game to fans of point and click adventures. Others might be put of by the slow gameplay or the dated tech. If you can look past such things, the game has an engaging bundle of science fiction and fantasy for you in store with a healthy chunk of humor.

33988455.review:
[h1] Cortez: So my secrets are being revealed, are they?
April: I wouldn't say that, because you're still a mystery to me. More so.
Cortez: Good. You see, señorita, mystery is important. To know everything, to know the whole truth, is dull. There is no magic in that. Magic is not knowing, magic is wondering about what and how and where. [/h1]

The Longest Journey — это одно из самых прекрасных и чудесных приключений за всю историю существования игроиндустрии и это без каких-либо преувеличений. 
Это больше, чем игра, это целая Одиссея для души. Путешествие, исход которого оставит после себя приятные ощущения и послевкусие. Путешествие, которое учит необходимости быть ответственным, храбрости, благородности и альтруизму. 
У игры весьма уникальный сеттинг, в ней объединены, сначала кажущиеся невозможными для объединения, два жанра: киберпанк и фэнтези. Два жанра органично интегрированы в сюжетную линию и сосуществуют друг с другом в абсолютном балансе, где один не перекрывает другого. 

Краткий синопсис: Эйприл Райан, наш игровой персонаж, 18-ти летняя художница, которая лелеет свою мечту поступить в престижную Венецианскую Академию Изобразительных Искусств, для чего уезжает из своего родного города, от семьи, и переезжает в крупных мегаполис Ньюпорт, где её долгий путь вскоре и начнётся. На протяжении этого долгого пути жизни мы повстречаем и замечательных и верных друзей и товарищей и подлейших врагов, мы будем заводить дружбу и со странными и чудными людьми и существами, встречать смертельные опасности и ставить перед собой задачи, которые на первый взгляд кажутся невыполнимыми, но хитрость, смекалка, отвага и ум, доблесть и альтруизм по отношению к другим помогут преодолеть все невзгоды трудного и опасного пути. Мы побываем в самых опасных закоулках морально прогнившего мегаполиса будущего и в цветущих и прекрасных садах, лесах и городах фэнтезийного мира магии. 

Это абсолютно чудесная и в прямом смысле магическая игра, которую я по праву считаю обязательной для прохождения. Игра и её история весьма длинная, объёмная и большая как по продолжительности, так и по содержанию, а темы и истины, которые она поднимает, хоть и кажутся простыми и типичными, но тем не менее и являются крайне важными и часто забываемыми самими людьми.

33934574.review:
Весьма нудный квест. Возможно, если бы я с ним впервые ознакомился в конце девяностых, когда он вышел, я бы относился к нему как-то иначе, но впервые я его прошёл только сейчас. Несколько лет назад проходил вторую часть. Особых восторгов она тогда не вызвала, но показалась достаточно приятной. Поэтому, собственно, и приобрёл первую: узнать предысторию. (Проблема только в том, что я уже благополучно позабывал, что там было во второй части, ну да ладно. :))

Геймплей категорически унылый. Больше всего угнетает отсутствие быстрого перехода между локациями, и при этом героиня идёт от одного конца экрана к другому приблизительно вечность (немного округлил, но секунд по 10 точно бывает). Тем не менее, оказалось, что анимацию ходьбы и прочие другие тормозные вещи всё же можно пропускать кнопкой Esc, если включить эту настройку в меню (чего авторы исходно делать не рекомендуют, так как можно пропустить куски сюжета или отдельные фразы!). Так что если соберётесь играть - сразу включайте эту настройку, а потом смело тыкайте Esc при ходьбе и других действиях, которые вы уже выполняли.

По сюжету тоже не могу сказать ничего особенно хорошего. Чувствуется, что задумка была эпохальной - сложное мироустройство, баланс магии и науки, какие-то хитрые схемы с драконами, тайными организациями, борьбой за власть и т.п. Я бы даже сказал, что перемудрили, если честно. На деле же, по моему мнению, получилась какая-то невнятная поделка с претензией. Наряду с вроде как продуманной картиной мира имеем наитупейшее поведение многих НПЦ, загадки с туманной логикой и суровый интерфейс с периодическим пиксель-хантингом. В общем, всё достаточно грустно.

Из плюсов могу отметить очень хорошую, на мой взгляд, озвучку. Актёры потрудились на славу. Голоса и живая манера речи без каких-либо специальных пауз и расстановок (у большинства персонажей) мне понравились.

Рекомендовать игру могу только тем, кто соберётся играть во все игры серии dreamfall: при прохождении последующих частей будет интересно натыкаться на отсылки к каким-то фактам из первой части, да и в целом знание истории мира dreamfall пригодится. Саму же по себе the longest journey, к сожалению, не рекомендую.

Uniquement en VO avec Steam, un Patch Français (voix et texte) est disponible sur le net.

Les graphismes sont ceux d'un jeu de l'an 2000 (même si la version sur Steam est de 2006). Si les décors sont encore assez plaisants à l'oeil malgré leur résolution réduite, certaines textures seront grossières et des détails piqueront les yeux de certains (animations, modélisations...), on peut rencontrer quelques bugs graphiques : personnages troués par endroits (les pnj notamment), fenêtre pop up illisible car toute blanche (tapez O pour Oui).

L'intéret réside dans le fait qu'il s'agit véritablement d'un bon jeu d'aventure "Old School" : beaucoup de dialogues, d'éléments pour cerner l'univers dans lequel on évolue, pas beaucoup d'aide sur ce qu'il faut faire, un espace de jeu plutôt grand, des objets et des combinaisons parfois complexes. Une règle : tout explorer, tout regarder, les zones d'interaction n'étant pas toujours évidentes du premier coup.

Le rythme est plutôt lent, notez que April peut courir en double Clickant (ou Esc lors des dialogues), c'est essentiellement du au fait qu'il faut régulièrement se déplacer d'une zone à l'autre et que certains échanges entres personnages sont long, l'écriture est bien poussée et la narration a une place importante. Globalement les enigmes ne devraient pas poser trop de problèmes car elles ne sont pas très nombreuses et plutôt logiques, il faudra le plus souvent savoir utiliser le bon objet au bon endroit.

Une aventure d'une bonne durée, une histoire bien écrite et avec une multitudes de détails pour donner beaucoup de profondeur (certains dialogues sont même "osés" chose plutôt rare), tout n'est pas parfait certes mais c'est quand même une belle référence du genre "aventure".

Un jeu qui mériterai un "Remaster".

33262597.review:
The Longest Journey is the reason I got into video games as a child. I connected easily with April Ryan (the protagonist), and the disbelief she initially expresses at her fantastical predicament injected an element of realism that even my younger self appreciated. Anybody in the real world, having found themselves transported to a fantasy realm, would react with skepticism much like April's.

The story itself is not tremendously original, but it is well-told, in a unique (and beautiful in its own way) setting, with characters that I found, and continue to find, memorable and endearing.

I loved this game as a child, and I love it more as an adult --- although there are parts that I still needed to consult a walkthrough to get past ;)

After having this gem gathering dust in my library for quite a few months I finally managed to fully play it through. And when I say 'gem' I really mean it.
I originally bought it simply because I wanted to play the two first games before getting to the actual Dreamfall Chapters. Now I'm actually really glad I made that decision. 
Of course this game is seventeen years old by now, which means the graphics might not be suited for everyone's eyes, but I don't think that should be seen as a negative factor. The story, however, if not the longest (depending on whether or not you're quick with point-and-click adventures) did impress me. For such an underrated and not well-known game it has one of the best fantasy-plots and worlds I've come across so far. And even if there isn't that much to be seen of some of the characters I did come to like them quite a lot.
For some of the bugs others have mentioned I can't say anything, since I haven't come across any (the text was screwed up on time, but reloading a previous save fixed it and it hasn't appeared again).
If there's a game that deserves a (graphical) remake it's definitely The Longest Journey and I am happy to say that I'm very excited for the other two games.

32129055.review:
This is a very good, if old, adventure game. Certain things about just didn't age very well - such as the 3d character models, fonts, and fmv sequences. However, the rest, the core or the game, from the voices to the story to the puzzles and gameplay held up very well.

The voice acting is very good, and when paired up with the dialogue it is really good at telling the story. It can be funny when it needs to be, or sombre when the occasion calls for it. The story itself also flows very well, with good pacing from when April is just going about her daily life and how it slowly builds into this long journey.

As far as the gameplay goes, the puzzles are pretty good. With plenty of characters to talk to, and the very useful diary mechanic to keep track of everything, although you can get stumped at times theres almost always a way to puzzle out the answer.

As far as the art in this game goes, it can be alright. In-game some of the models used in characters look extremely low resolution, but it's not too off-putting. The fmv sequences are just ugly to look at. But all of the static backgrounds in this are great, from the downtown of venice to the seaside cliffs in arcadia. They just look fantastic, even at such a low resolution.

Technically, the game runs okay-ish. But you need to remember to quit the game properly, else it messes with the Windows Font settings. Also, you may wish to create a "power plan" to use, as by default these old games tend to use 100% of your cpu resources, which can be undesirable.

If you can look past some of the quirks of the technology it was built with, its worth playing for fans of this genre.

32024880.review:
The Longest Journey is a 1999 point-and-click adventure game set in two parallel worlds, the cyberpunk-based Stark and fantasy-inspired Arcadia. 
The game features some of the best lore of any game I've played, spectacular voice acting, and amazing writing.
Despite the dated graphics, the game has still held up extremely well, and is in my opinion one of the greaest adventure games ever made. The graphics are worth looking past in order to enjoy the great story hidden underneath.
I highly recommend playing this game before any of the newer entries in the series, because it really is a spectacular story and provides a lot of important background and characterization for many of the characters in the universe.

31759232.review:
When this game was released (late 1999, early 2000) it was several months on no#0 (they had this 0-9 top10 thing) spot in the best TV show (in my country) about latest video games. The kid I was back then wasn't very much into adventure games but have remembered that fact as probably no other game spent so many time on that spot. El Duderino that I'm now is still not a huge adventure games fan but likes to try something from that genre now and then (Dracula and Sam&Max series being the favorites). The reputation this game has as one of the best in the branch is well desereved. Those funny Norwegians have done a great job!

Playing this was just like the title says...it was like taking a very long journey. A thoroughly enjoyable one.
Some would say that the graphics are awful but in all honesty if that is true it didn't bother me at all (played on 1080p monitor and the picture wasn't stretched or anything). The moment I dived into such an interesting story with completely believable characters I was just there. It felt like I could actually touch the person I talk to or stand on a cliff and look into the depth of a beautiful landscape while the breeze on my face. The mixture between magic and logic, fairy tale and (futuristic) reality is done great and you never get tired of either. I slightly liked more the magical part. The struggle within the main character is also properly served before the player and progresses in adequate tempo as the game rolls out. Voice acting is spot on as well as the music. I'm not going into any details on purpose, you gotta inhale them on your own.

I would suggest playing in little doses (those 25 hours you see happened over last 4 months but no need to have such a slow tempo xD), couple hours per day tops. That way you won't be annoyed by long walks/runs across new or known screens which this game (unfortunatelly but not tragically) delivers. Don't worry about forgetting parts of the story if you stay away for some time, it won't happen I asure you (but if it does there is an automatic in-game Diary that will help out in a jiffy). ;)
If you have technical issues with menues or something there is a very quick solution for that (Google is your friend).
The puzzles are perfectly balanced, not naive but not "head-breaking" either. About 90% I figured on my own and for the rest I used [url=http://www.uhs-hints.com]Universal Hint System[/url] which I find to be a wonderful solution when you're stucked because that little wink pointing you in the right direction always feels better than watching/reading a blunt walkthrough.

Summa summarum...an absolute must-play for any gamer that likes games with a soul.
And if this will one day be taught in art history schools or something similar it won't be so by accident as this really is art.

31625308.review:
Magnifique.

Très bien écrit. Excellent scénario. Il mérite bien son statut de jeu culte.

La VF en ce temps était encore de grande qualité. (le jeu est patchable Fr textes et voix)

Le jeu raconte l'histoire et les embûches d'April Ryan,  amenée, presque contre son gré à se lancer dans une aventure épique ou l'on aura la joie de jouer dans le monde de la Logique , Stark (le notre) et Arcadia, le monde magique avec ses créatures et peuples variés afin de récupérer le matériel nécessaire à la sauvegarde de "l'équilibre" entre les deux mondes.

Le jeu est orienté science-fiction. Type Point'n'click classique

C'est le premier jeu d'une trilogie dont les suites sont de grandes qualités également.

Le seul défaut , si s'en est un, est de très grandes discussions à notre arrivée à Arcadia afin de planter le scénario dans notre caboche.

Quand on amène à penser pouvoir anticiper les évenements niveau scénario, et que donc elle est téléphonée, le jeu nous prendre à contre-pied, et plus d'une fois, il est donc d'une grande richesse scenaristique. Il y a également quelques scènes très humoristiques.

Le jeu plaira aux Fans de Star Wars, pour la quête initiatique ainsi que le mélange de races différentes sur Arcadia. Une certaine espèce m'a vraiment fait penser aux eworks. D'autres aux Gungan qui vivent également dans une cité sous les mers.
 
Un jeu culte donc à découvrir absolument

31435939.review:
Only for big point-and-click fans.

I played as someone who has only played a few point-and-clicks and graphic adventures, being a fan of Broken Sword, Snatcher and Policenauts. Point-and-click fans will no doubt love this; it's relatively well made. But for those who don't list it as their favourite genre, this will be more of a miss.

My major problem was how long everything took - there's a lot of walking/running to and from locations, and even just running across screens can take too long. The amount of needless, unskippable walking (and other movement), not just by you but by other characters in a little cutscene or to begin conversation, is obscene. Imagine a 20-hour movie where 10 hours of it is walking. This might be an underestimation. (Note that there is an option to skip the animations, however the game tells you not to as this skips any major plot points that happen during the animation - these are mini cutscenes after all - and is only meant for those who are doing another playthrough.)

This combined with the hefty amount of talking, but a script and voice acting that didn't keep me glued (all but one character had me just reading the subtitles fast and skipping through), I tapped out after a few chapters. To continue would've been a slog of watching pointless walking and little arm gestures that take 10 seconds a time.

31328443.review:
What a beautiful game! Certainly one of the best point and click adventure game, if not the best ever. It didn't age well (had to play in 640x480 windowed mode on a 24" monitor) but the story makes that up. Which is really good. Actually I was thinking about the golden age Final Fantasy games while playing this. Because it's really similar to some of them (like 7-8-9). Ofc it's not an RPG but an adventure game... but the story, the settings, the music etc. a lot of things reminded me to the Final Fantasy series. 

Really hard to talk without spoilers but if you don't mind the graphics then you will definitely enjoy the game. Starts a bit slow and sometimes a bit tedious (mostly the puzzles) yet I never felt that I play it just to finish as quickly as possible.

The character development is interesting but at one part the game just stops caring about it which is kind of a let down. There are a lot of undiscovered areas in the game (more background story of the world, the characters etc.)

I'd love to see a proper HD remake!

Here is a pretty good non-spoiler walkthrough if you don't care about the puzzles (and you shouldn't really... I mean most of them don't add anything to the game apart from difficulty): http://www.ladyofthecake.com/thelongestjourney/index.html

31041933.review: A very good quaint adventure game with a good story and excellent voice acting.  A few of the puzzles are not the most logical and will likely frustrate, but there is an good walkthrough guide available on Steam if you need it.

30907298.review:
I know this is supposed to be one of the best adventure games of all time, and I really wanted to like it, but it just kept dropping me right when I thought it was getting good.

The character development at the start of this game looks detailed and promising, but it doesn't follow through with a complete theme. It starts with one theme, then abruptly picks up another, starting with a unique character and ending with a stereotype.

The puzzles are difficult, and there are a lot of them, but they aren't very intuitive. They're good for a brain exercise, but I didn't find them fun. I ran to the walkthrough a lot (and I hate walkthroughs) because the game design didn't get me to care about the puzzles. This could very well be personal preference, though.

You can sprint or walk, but even while sprinting....You. Run. So. Slowly. Over. Vast. Distances. 

The game world tried very, very hard to be immersive and one-of-a-kind. It offered a lot in the way of lore and history to the world, locations, etc. But I found it all to be ultimately lacking. It felt like somebody who loved fantasy and sci-fi writing one of their first stories. Not bad at all; I can tell they loved their creation, and I appreciate their efforts. But it's not something I would want to PAY for, if you know what I mean. 

It's not a bad game. Don't get me wrong. I did enjoy parts of it. But, for the most part, I found myself continuing just for the sake of finishing, and in the hope it would get better along the way. I did buy the sequel, so, again, it's not a bad game. But it's not a great one, either. Just average.

30733029.review:
The Longest Journey – это увлекательная история о девушке Эйприл, студентке и художнице из 23 века. Земля здесь представляет собой два параллельных мира – Старк и Аркадию. Первый – мир науки и технологий, где живут люди своей обычной жизнью. Аркадия же – мир магии. Однажды Эйприл во сне попадает в Аркадию и тут начинается ее длинное путешествие...

Плюсы:
✚ Отличный саундтрек с душой, идеально вписывающийся в игру. Один из лучших.
✚ Озвучка персонажей на высочайшем уровне, особенно у главных героев Эйприл и Ворона.
✚ Много хорошего юмора.
✚ Сюжет не на шутку увлекает, хочется играть и играть дальше. Я реально с трудом отрывался от монитора.
✚ А самое главное – в игре есть непередаваемая словами атмосфера. Что-то такое похожее на Сайбирию, только ещё лучше.

В своё время эта игра каким-то образом прошла мимо меня и я впервые поиграл в неё лишь только в 2016 году. Но могу смело сказать – это одна из лучших адвенчур, что я играл. Если вы любите приключения и вас не пугает устаревшая графика – берите обязательно.

30159709.review:
Лебединая песня жанру классических квестов. Очень длинное, полностью оправдывающее свое название приключение, в котором сплелись два классических мира всех писателей жанра фэнтези/фантастика. С одной стороны футуристичный Старк, наполненный технологиями, наукой, общественным неравенством, корпорациями, киберпанком, нуаром и тому подобным, с другой - сказочная Аркадия со средневековым антуражем, крохотными городками, всевозможными магическими существами, заливистыми лугами, дремучими лесами и кристально чистыми морями. Миры разделены неким балансом, сохранение которого стоит под угрозой. Срочно нужен кто? Правильно, избранный. Избранная!

Эйприл Райан, девушка с весенним именем и гланая героиня, имеет сложные отношения со своими родителями, сбегает по совершеннолетию в большой город всех вечных студентов Ньюпорт и поступает в элитную академию искусств. Только было начавшаяся новая прекрасная жизнь омрачается беспокойными и реалистичными снами, странными персонами и сложными приколами. Вскоре ей предстоит столкнуться с другим миром, путешествиями, приключениями... в общем, journey. 

[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=796941162[/url]
Это самое journey подается в виде красочных заранее отрендеренных задников и трехмерных героев. Вот вам курсор, кликайте по всему интересному, собирайте предметы, комбинируйте, используйте логику, смекалку, здравный смысл, а иногда полное отсутствие всего этого. А еще предстоит много общаться, местная фауна очень словохотлива, погружая в свои истории, устройство мира и направляя для решения (или запутываня) загадок. Сами задачки представляют собой как простейшие логические моменты типа использовать монетку за неименеем отвертки, так более сложные комбинации (как с помощью веревки, зажима и дырявой надувной утки достать ключ, застрявший в рельсах под напряжением?). Как и полагается играм с одним решением проблемы, вы порой будете просто, извините, жoпу рвать в бессильных попытках понять, что хочет от вас игра. Причем это не обязательно ваша плохо развитая смекалка, вы можете просто пропустить нужным предмет.

[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=855297230[/url]
Тупиковых моментов в игре нет, главная героиня не может умереть или проиграть [strike]с подливой[/strike]. Это довольно спорное решение, которое плохо отражается на редких напряженных моментах, когда, казалось бы, нужно действовать быстро, но пф, враг все равно никогда Эйприл не достанет, можно спокойно чесать затылок и попивать кофеек. Однако TLJ не дает заскучать постоянной сменой антуража и лихим сюжетом, в котором намешаны путешествия между мирами, могущественная корпорация, колдуны и драконы, маленькие проблемы маленьких существ и серьезны передряги серьезных людей, добрый и порой слегка пошлый юмор, друзья, товарищи, знакомые и просто интересные личности. А концовка оставляет после себя мысли о... а нет, пройдите сами.

[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=798573366[/url]
The Longest Journey является, в общем-то, законченным произведением, у которого в 2006-ом появилось продолжение, а совсем недавно и третья часть, поделенная на серии. Если захотите познакомиться с этой приключенческой сагой, настоятельно рекомендую начать именно с этой части, которая подарит вам интересные часы действительно [strike]бесконечного[/strike] очень длинного путешествия. Встречать старых знакомых и возвращаться в полюбившиеся места в продолжениях одно удовольствие.

[i]Чтобы решить проблемы с низким разрешением и другими артефактами на современных компьютерах, обратитесь к моему [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=797366829]руководству[/url].
