29525258.review:
您提名此游戏角逐：“THE LONGEST JOURNEY”奖。
感谢TLJ带给我的这一段奇妙的旅程。

[spoiler]死活打不上汉化补丁，心一横就下了个盗版……[/spoiler]

8/10

通关了。如果不看画质的话很难想象这是个00年的游戏，游戏里有很多超出游戏内容之外的讨论，而传达出的观念就其发行年代来说的确非常难得。主角在两个世界之间来回的冒险经历也好，每一个出场角色的刻画也好，的确功底深厚，对得起对这个游戏的赞誉。

酷鸦太帅了。又绅士又贫嘴，感觉新年伊始就对一只鸟动心实在不大好……另外游戏的主角也是少有的行为圣母却不让人厌烦的人，天选之人嫌弃自己命运的桥段不太少见，但是能把其矛盾心理刻画得这么漂亮的游戏的确稀有。另外主角说话也很刻薄啊，非常非常非常有趣。

扣一分在跳出错误发生得太频繁，另一分扣在对世界观的讲述实在太冗长了，说实话我个人很喜欢这种方式，不太生硬也足够详细，但是最开始树精那一通逼叨实在让刚开始玩游戏的人觉得不耐烦。

如果不在乎游戏的画面，又对大段大段文字叙述以及宏大世界观的游戏有兴趣的话，这是一款不可错过的佳作。

29512898.review:
A classic PC game that was pushing the medium almost 17 years ago. It's still beautiful, it's still emotional, funny and immersive.

It's a point-and-click adventure game unlike anything I've ever played. The game has a well-realized world that gives off a very European, 80s-90s sci-fi vibe. The amount of cinematic beauty such a low-budget game can come out with is impressive.

The story is very detailed and probably the most important aspect of the game, this isn't JUST a puzzle-solving point-and-click. I'd say it's a visual novel as well, with full voice-acting. Some NPCs can talk for up to twenty minutes about the well-realized lore created by the development team. It's got a snarky and relatable main character that keeps every moment interesting as she projects her personality onto any situation by using the "examine" feature.

My only gripes with this one is that the game drags on a little long near the middle, and a few of the puzzles are just ridiculous and you'll either have to get really creative with your problem-solving skills, or be following a guide.

Even if you're put off by puzzle-solving or point-and-clicks, I'd still say give this a chance if it goes on sale or you feel sponatenous. Its greatest strength is putting ADVENTURE in an Adventure game.

29266925.review:
Après avoir joué à Dreamfall TLJ et Dreamfall Chapters, deux jeux que j'ai vraiment aimé,  je me disait qu'il me fallait absolument jouer au jeu d'où tout était parti, les origines, April Ryan quoi. J'en attendais donc beaucoup.

Le début du jeu est très bien, passer d'un monde à l'autre, Stark, Arcadia, l'intrigue se dessine, tout ça. D'autant plus qu'ayant joué aux deux autres opus, des lieux et des personnages me sont familiers.  J’éprouve une certaine satisfaction. Je suis rassuré. Mais au bout de quelques heures, un léger ennuie commence à se faire ressentir, l'histoire est devenue un mièvre, malgré le ton acide d'April Ryan, j'ai le sentiment que l'on ne s'adresse plus au même public. Les personnages rencontré ont une façon très caricaturale de parler, parfois risible, parfois agaçante (dans la version Française tout du moins), spécialement un (Le Draïkins sous-marin) qui nous achève, qui nous donne envie que tout ça finisse.

Bon, j'arrête là pour ne pas dissuader d'éventuels acquéreurs du jeu, ce n'est pas mon but. De toutes façon je ne compte pas mettre une évaluation négative ni descendre le jeu. Malgré ses défauts, techniques et narratifs, ses textures absentes, j'ai passé un bon moment, j'ai joué a bien pire et respect aux anciens (1999).

29134784.review:
The Longest Journey is an amazing story adventure game and perfects the point & click genre. In terms of story, the game excels and the world is equally incredible as it incorporates both sci-fi & fantasy elements. The Longest Journey is imaginative in its way of creating a diverse and unique universe filled with lore and characters that remain memorable. April Ryan is fantastic as the game's leading protagonist. She is well written and stands out as a main character. The world is truly great from the moment the player enters the futuristic world of Earth, being set about 300 years into the future. Sci-fi alone is done so well in this game and so is the fantasy aspect inspired by classic medieval lore with a fantastical touch. 

While filled with great lore and characters, the adventure filled game play can seem slow at times due to April's walk speed and this requires a bit of patience. This may be a problem as it can make the game experience seem a tedious one. Nonetheless, despite this The Longest Journey features amazing voice acting and dialogue coupled with a very well written script. This game is a true classic and really is one of the greatest adventure games ever made; nothing since has really compared to the degree of detail evident in the game's story structure and lore. Scale-wise, it is a series filled with imaginative lore containing creatures and characters from different worlds and backgrounds. This all combines to make an outstanding story adventure. The Longest Journey is the first of the Dreamfall series and anyone interested in fantasy, or sci-fi with an emphasis on narrative should definitely experience this game.

It does have quite a few puzzles, and some of them feel a bit out of place, but I know that some fans of adventure games miss this kind of gameplay in modern point & clicks.

29112747.review:
I don't recommend this game.

Sorry, but I've spent 5 hours in the game trying to find a reason why people like this game and keep recommending it on Steam. It's a decent game pure technically and runs smoothly but it's faults are too serious to ignore.

This game offers
*Dissapointing humour
*Boring storyline
*Unrelatable heroine
*One-dimentional side characters
*And some no-sense-making puzzles

Including some minor technicalities as well

Like seriously, I can see why people liked it 16 years ago, but now? Please, there are tons of games better than this one available on Steam today. There is no reason to play through this game these days (as I also hear it's very long). 

I didn't like the heroine, since she always fails to be funny, whines about how difficult the truth is to accept, yells at the only character who understands and obviously wants to help her (even though she secretly believes in everything he says) and... she sometimes speak like a robot. Also, she's a complete nobody with seemingly no personality. Thank god there are worse characters in the game!

The story itself, isn't the best one. I wasn't amazed in any way. It's just too boring. Another "Save the world" kind of plot, basically. As if I've never heard that one before... Nothing new or unique, just dissapointing.

And please, the humour in this is unbareably cringeworthy! I'm refering to a scene in some back-alley where you use a certain toy and a certain garbage pile and make it look like a cop pointing a gun at someone and shouting: "Do the ape dance" or something equally silly. And guess what? He falls for it... hillarious(!) That's the kind of humour you will have to endure by playing this.

I've heard so much great things about this game and I've looked forward to trying it out for quite a while, but I can't finish it if the whole game will be like this. So could someone, anybody, please tell me exactly where this "Journey" actually starts? Because, right now... I'll settle for the end.

28909998.review:
Так уж вышло, что на момент выхода игры я ее ни видом не видывал, ни слыхом не слыхивал. 
Потом был Dreamfall The Longest Journey, которую некоторые читаемые мной в то время игровые издательства воздвигли в лучшие игры года. Однако же ни красочные скриншоты, ни красивые статьи, ни даже факт номинаций на лучшую игру года не побудили меня сыграть в эту серии игр.

(Думаю, вы уже и сами поняли, сколь же сильно я заблуждался.)

Снова вспомнил про эту серию, услышав про Chapters, году так в 2015, но как-то снова не сложилось - первые две части отчего-то в стиме были недоступны для ру-региона. Пока, наконец, в ноябре 2016 я, не особо на что-либо рассчитывая, не открыл их странички и с удивлением не обнаружил, что - вот оно! Уже можно купить! Что я и сделал.

Ну-с, вот как-то так я в мир The Longest Journey и попал, и теперь, когда с введением покончено, перейду к самой игре.

Первое, что я хочу сказать - никогда не был ярым фанатом квестов. В большинстве из них меня коробило от какой-то совершенно не поддающейся рациональному объяснению логики разработчиков, вроде такого: есть пересохшее русло неглубокой речушки, есть мостик через нее, но мостик сломан. Надо перейти на другую сторону. Логично: пересечь высохшее русло пешком. Разработчики: надо пойти на стройку, найти кирпич, подслушать разговор двух бомжей, выменять у одного из них кирпич на топорик, вернуться к реке, топориком сломать припрятанную в кустах лодку... и так далее.
Так вот - в The Longest Journey подобных действий [i]почти[/i] нет. Вот с ходу могу припомнить разве что комбинацию из надувной уточки, веревки и клещей, чтобы достать какой-то предмет с рельс в метро. В остальное же время игра демонстрирует завидное постоянство в тезисе "как должны выглядеть задачки в квестах, чтобы не казаться высосанными из пальца". Уже за одно только это я ее полюбил. Но не одной логичностью едины.

Поиграв буквально минут десять или около того, начинаешь понимать, что перед тобой не просто квест, но настоящее произведение искусства, причем со множеством проработанных мелких деталей. Вот, скажем, один из первых предметов, которые могут попасть к вам в инвентарь, представляет собой листик с растения, стоящего возле нашей комнаты в холле. Казалось бы - ну листик и листик, что тут такого? Нет, оказывается, это не какой-то там листик, а лист самого настоящего органического пластика, который очищает воздух заметно эффективнее обычных растений и не требует поливки! Или шаттлы на антиграве, "самый безопасный вид транспорта в истории, но только до тех пор, пока вы не находитесь в нем". Играют ли эти сведения какую-либо сюжетную роль? Нет, ни разу. Сказываются ли эти сведения на степени погружения в удивительный мир The Longest Journey? О да, еще как. 

А мир тут действительно хорош. Вернее, миры: ведь играть предстоит сразу в двух мирах - в нашем, мире логики и технологий, и в параллельном, мире магии и сказки. Первый - киберпанк (причем не так чтобы до мозга костей антиутопичный - что редкость уже само по себе) с легким налетом дизельпанка. Второй - фэнтези с магическими созданиями, вроде расы венаров - существ, для которых понятие "время" не существует, и потому в разговоре они выдают что-то вроде "Когда мы пройдём на ту сторону завесы, и время вновь открылось нам, я возвращаюсь к своим людям. Я так жду этого дня!" С учетом вышеозначенного внимания к мелким деталям оба мира действительно интересно изучать и копаться в их историях.

Вот вам уже три причины полюбить эту игру. Мало? Ну, держите еще две - хорошую актерскую игру (в плане озвучки) и сюжет, который в общем представляет собой классическое "баланс добра и зла, света и тьмы", но в частности - это нечто совершенно иное.

Не минусы, но не могу не упомянуть еще два пункта. Первый - игра, хотя вышла она в конце 90-х, графику имеет уровня середины 90-х. То есть примерно уровня PS1. Мешает ли это играть? С учетом всех перечисленных плюсов, мой ответ - нет. Но вот какие-то мелкие графические детали вселенной из-за этого страдают, вроде надписей на дорожных знаках и иже с ними. Второй пункт - "40+ часов геймплея". Как?.. Откуда?.. Игра ведь проходится за 15 часов, и это - не спеша, с учетом изучения окружения. 

А что в итоге-то, спросите вы? Рекомендую ли я The Longest Journey? Да, однозначно. Даже сейчас, с уже десять раз как устаревшей визуальной частью, она умудряется захватывать в свой мир с головой. Нужна ли эта игра конкретно вам? Хочется верить, что мой обзор поможет вам в принятии решения.

28508862.review:
Конечно как и многие я заинтересовался этой вселенной когда увидел несколько трейлеров игры Dreamfall: Chapters. Немного почитав, понял, что не достоин даже запускать ее, пока не пройду предыдущие 2 игры. Я конечно не особо обращаю внимание на графику, мне главное геймплей подавай. Но слукавлю если напишу, что графика с самого начала меня не отпугнула. За интересным геймплеем ты забываешь о графике уже спустя 30 минут и чем дальше, тем интереснее. 

Как квест, я напишу, что он потрясающий, он не сложный и самое главное не нудный. Есть довольно интересные загадки и головоломки, но особых проблем я не испытал. Единственной проблемой было, когда ты пропускал важный предмет и из-за его отсутствия ты не мог дальше продвинуться по сюжету, но побегать не составит труда, главное нажимайте клавишу Esc. Я прошел игру без гайдов и у меня ушло 21 час, с 40 часами обманули)  

Понравилось как проработали 2 мира с нуля и придумали эту вселенную, с удовольствием посмотрел бы фильм или почитал бы комикс по мотивам этой игры. С сюжетом у игры проблем нет, также раз за разом он удивляет и где только мы не побываем, действительно, удивительное путешествие, которое навсегда останется в наших сердцах и захочется возвращаться снова и снова, что бы пережить это и испытать эмоции снова.

У игры потрясающий саундтрек, который отлично дополняет определенную ситуацию или создает нужное настроение в нужной локации. С юмором у игры тоже все на должном уровне. Тут есть пара интерактивных ситуаций, но особо на сюжет они не влияют. CGI-ролики, они хоть и 99 года, но я смотрел на них с удовольствием, очень радовали глаз. Наверное потому что они редко так появляются. 

Один из лучших квестов в который я играл, адекватная и приятная сложность, не пришлось пользоваться гайдами. Мир, где ты задашь все вопросы, прочитаешь все книги и послушаешь все истории и сказки у NPC. Лишь бы еще сильнее погрузиться в этот удивительный мир. Крайне рекомендую к покупке, даже с учетом того что игра не дешевая с ее то картинкой и годом выпуска.

Моя оценка: 9,5 из 10..

28183993.review:
The Longest Journey

Para ser sinceros, la primera vez que tuve la oportunidad de jugarlo, desistí de el. Lo siento, de verdad, espero que algún día puedan perdonarme. No puedo recordar porque tomé aquella paupérrima  decisión, pero la hice, y comencé la historia como no se debe,  con su secuela (Dreamfall: The longest Journey). No creo que haga falta aclarar que estaba más perdido que surfista boliviano, bueno, por lo menos al principio. Conforme avancé en la historia pude comprenderla mejor, pero no como debería.
 Pero un día todo cambió, esa desazón por no saber que jugar me llevó a descargar el juego y a "re-jugar" la saga. Y me dije bueno, probemos con [b] The Longest Journey[/b], Abrí el juego y pensé que era un juego más de miles, pero enseguida veo que no. No es un juego de puzzle, ni una aventura gráfica, ni un point & click. Es una obra de arte, relatada con la precisión y sensibilidad perfecta. Poco merecido tengo, emitir opinión alguna sobre este pedazo de juego.

 Es uno de esos juegos que hay que jugar antes de morir, altamente recomendado, este y sus secuelas.

11/10

28177993.review: Definitely lives up to its title.

28177646.review:
Pros:
Story-The story of The Longest Journey is probably one of the best I've seen in a video game. When you think the game becomes too predictable, it quickly throws you into a loop to think otherwise. 
World-The world I think was "magical" if I was to be so blunt. The environment and background images were truly beautiful. 

Cons:
Font-The game turns off clearfont setting in my pc, so I have to turn them back on again after playing. 
Hidden agenda-Some of the characters in the game seemed forced to act a certain way to appease some sort of hidden political/social agenda by the developers. 
Voice Acting-Some of the voice acting for the side characters seemed pretty bad to me. One character spoke in a monotonic voice in one sentence, but then spoke in a 1950's greaser accent. There are others as well that bothered me. 
Puzzles-Most of the puzzles in the game were pretty good, but some in the first few chapters were pretty ludicrous. 
Graphics-I'm used to old graphics, but obviously some people don't like outdated graphics.
Language-Wish at least the subtitles in the game would be in norsk, that way I could practice bokmål. 

All in all, I really enjoyed the game and would recommend it to friends. If side characters bother you, just skip through or ignore the extra diolgue with them. Use a guide if a puzzle gets too annoying for you.

28170158.review:
Что же такого можно написать о [b]The Longest Journey[/b], чтобы привлечь к ней современного геймера? Игра вышла в далеком 1999 году, была положительно оценена критиками, но распространения в широком кругу так и не получила. Не так давно зарелизилась [b]Dreamfall: Chapters[/b] - духовная наследница TLJ, 3-ья игра в серии, которая само собой сделана уже на современный лад и в соответствии с нынешними игровыми канонами. Так вот, если у вас есть желание познакомиться поближе с таинственными мирами Старка и Аркадии, узнать, с чего все началось, ну и если у вас нет аллергии на графон того времени, то определенно стоит выделить время на прохождение сей замечательной адвенчуры.

[b]Сюжетная линия[/b] происходит в двух, упомянутых выше мирах: Старке и Аркадии. Старк больше напоминает мир из научной фантастики, где описывают футуристические мегаполисы. Там и летающие машины, куча роботов и новых технологий. Аркадия же кишит различными забавными существами и народами, да и магия там не на последнем месте.
Молодая девушка по имени Эйприл узнает, что может перемещаться между этими двумя мирами и что от нее зависит их судьба. 

[b]Геймплей[/b] состоит из кучи различных квестов, мини-игр и прочих типичных действий для адвенчуры. Главную героиню постоянно придется перемещать между локациями, бегать из одного места в другое, что порой весьма утомляет. Задачки здесь довольно сложные, по крайней мере мне они таковыми показались. Поэтому я играл строго по прохождению. Ибо можно не взять в какой-либо локации какой-либо предмет, а потом возвращаться за ним в течение долгого времени.

Стоит ли отдельно говорить о [b]графике[/b]? Она, конечно же устарела. Можно сесть и начать считать полигоны на лице Эйприл. Только в этом нет необходимости, ибо в такой игре графика быстро уходит на второй план и спустя пару часов игры уже и не замечаешь, что играешь в игру 1999-го года. К слову ролики сделаны весьма качественно. А в некоторых локациях и вовсе замечаешь потрясающие пейзажи.

[b]Звуковую составляющую[/b] можно только похвалить. Вся музыка в игре прекрасно дополняет игровой процесс, больше и добавить нечего.

Касательно технической составляющей хотел бы сказать, что стоит сразу настроить [b]The Longest Journey[/b] для комфортной игры на современных ПК по одному из руководств. Так как в стандартной комплектации даже из игры выйти не получится. Проблемы возникают при сворачивании игры - этого делать вообще не стоит. Она либо свернется в окно, либо просто зависнет намертво. В остальном же проблем не возникает, по крайней мере у меня за все 12 часов игры не было никаких косяков. Для тех, кто желает поиграть на русском, советую русификатор звука и текста от Snowball. Другие не пробовал, не могу ничего сказать по ним.

Для меня тяжеловато отдельно выписать плюсы и минусы данной игры. Что меня немного утомляло в игре, так это сложноватые квесты и бесконечная беготня. Но это сугубо мои причуды. Также хочу отметить, что игру прохожу во второй раз. Первый раз проходил еще пиратку лет 5 назад. От обоих прохождений получил колоссальное удовольствие!

[b]Вердикт:[/b]
[table]
        [th]Превосходнейший сторилайн, отличные персонажи и крутая атмосфера футуристического и магического миров. Ценители жанра и фанаты серии Dreamfall в целом должны со мной согласится. Это определенно эталон адвенчур, послуживший серьезным толчком в дальнейшем развитии этого жанра в игровой индустрии.[/th]
        [th][b]Оценка: 10/10[/b][/th]
[/table]

Old game, with old graphics and slow animations that sometimes will irritate you.
Those are the only bad things I can say about the game, although I don't really mind at all it being old or the graphics.
Not that kind of point-and-click game that you just gotta find all the items in the screen, maybe combine them and booyah, proceed. There's just so much stuff involved around the puzzles and that's what makes it one of the best point-and-click games of all time.
The characters are really well made, no character appears without adding substance to the game and you will definitely love the Apryl, her attitude throughout the game is really cool. I love when the MC captivates me in a game.
The story, which is the most important thing in a game for me, is simply amazing. Crazy plot twists that make your mind blow in a good way. You play the game, something happens, then you want to keep playing to get the answers and see the story unfold. It's full of surprise and emotions that create an incredible experience.
If you love adventure games, puzzles and enjoy a great story, by all means, give The Longest Journey a try.

27549207.review:
Long ago I was bored and I went to Walmart to find a game to play.  There wasn't a large selection, and I was about to try Deus EX when I saw The Longest Journey behind it.  I had never heard anything about it, but it looked more interesting than Deus Ex.  Longest Journey turned out to be one of the best investments in gaming I ever made.  Great Story, great voice actors, VERY long,  I enjoyed every minute of it, and I still wonder about the fates of some of the characters April met during her journey.    

One of my favorite lines comes from this game.  At the docks in Acadia, April looks at the blue flames on towers around the harbor and says:  "It is either propane or magic, and I'm betting it isn't propane."  

There are some who object to the language in this game, but I don't think it is out of place.  The scene with the intercom in the warehouse district is the worst part of it, and it is a hilarious scene:  A speaker blaring obscenities in an echoing environment.

The graphics are adequate to the task for the most part; it's the dialogue that counts.  They say that the English speaking girl who voices April Ryan is good, but the girl in the French version is even better.  Makes me wish I knew French.   I would like to hear the French version of "Screw you, Jerry." - April's response to a stickler for details, delivered with her characteristically sweet voice.

27231532.review:
Когда мне было 10 лет или около того (это было 10 лет назад - или около того), я совершенно случайно открыла для себя игру "Dreamfall". Я мало что знала о компьютерных играх, но я точно знала, что ВЛЮБИЛАСЬ в эту игру. Я провела в ней множество прекрасных минут.

Когда история "Dreamfall" оборвалась, у меня наступила ломка. Такое похмелье, которое наступает после того, как ты знакомишься с по-настоящему классной историей и не знаешь, как жить дальше в реальном мире. И тут я (снова совершенно случайно) узнаю, что у Dreamfall существует приквел - The Longest Journey, герой этого обзора! Я нашла эту игру, скачала ее, установила, запустила, иии... Не смогла в нее играть. Графика была настолько непривычной для меня, что я решила, что у меня какая-то сломанная версия игры (ЛОЛ). 

Я пыталась скачивать игру с других источников, переустанавливала ее по 10 раз, искала решение проблемы в интернете, но этой странной проблемы с графикой не было ни у кого, кроме меня. Что ж, мне пришлось отказаться от дальнейших попыток и отложить идею поиграть в The Longest Journey в сторонку. Да, я была на редкость тупым ребенком.

И вот, 10 лет спустя, я отряхиваю пыль со своих детских воспоминаний, покупаю The Longest Journey и погружаюсь в потрясающий, абсолютно волшебный мир. Я тот еще графодрочер, но мне было абсолютно _плевать_ на графику. Невероятно интересный сюжет, персонажи (даже второстепенные были мне интересны), постоянные прыжки из реального мира в магический... Я думаю, эта игра относится к категории тех, которые я буду перепроходить каждый год. Как любимая книга, которую тебе никогда не надоест перечитывать, в которой ты всегда найдешь что-то новое.

Эта игра для меня - как настойка боярышника: в 10 лет я ее не оценила, а сейчас люблю самой горячей любовью.

27192860.review: One of my favourite narrative games of all time, although the graphics are rather dated.

27134627.review:
This is a game I stumbled across by pure chance when Amazon recommended it to me, I played it and it fast became one of my favourite games ever.  The graphics are dated now but to be honest the rich story and lore, the varied characters and personalities (and the way the game makes you care about them) and great voice acting more than make up for it.

Its a fantasy story, sweet and lighthearted in some places, dark and sad in others. I loved the sequel Dreamfall too, and think I will love Chapters when I get round to playing it, but for now TLJ holds the top spot for me in the saga, and in point n click adventure games in general. 

 I should probably also say the game is pretty dialogue heavy, personally I don't mind, I like talking to and bantering with  the characters and finding out more about them etc, but if you prefer action and fast pacing you may not enjoy the game so much. Also if graphics  are a big deal to you, and you can't look past them then possibly give it a miss too. 

Otherwise this game is probably one of the best adventure games I have ever played, with a strong fantasy story and likeable, believable, and well developed characters and if you love the traditional adventure genre and fantasy this game (and series in general) is highly recommended.

Геймплейно The Longest Journey - point'n'click адвенчура. Сюжет повествует о нарушении баланса между миром науки и миром магии и о девушке Эйприл, которой и придется этот бардак разгребать. Возможно сейчас игра выглядит не так невероятно как в 2000-м, но это ни капли не умаляет ее достоинств, и не мешает погрузиться в мир игры с головой. Потрясающая история и захватывающий мир игры по праву делают ее одной из лучших компьютерных игр 21 века. Я верю этот мир реален.

The Longest Journey é um "point'n'click", cenários pré-renderizados, câmera estática, jogabilidade as vezes estranha e ainda sim é um 10/10. 25993224.review:
This is a point-and-click adventure game with 3D characters on 2D backgrounds. It's an epic chosen-one story that, to me, doesn't quite feel finished in some middle parts. [url=http://forums.longestjourney.com/showthread.php?8950-Menu-font-on-Steam&p=111360&viewfull=1#post111360][b]Get these fonts[/b][/url] and put that folder in your game directory, because the game expects them but does not include them. Also, I highly recommend forcing anti-aliasing in your graphics card settings, since the game runs at 640×480. Or you could try forcing a high resolution with dgVoodoo, though I haven't done so.

The game's point-and-click interface works like this: If you click on something you can do more than look at (and hear your character's thoughts on), it'll bring up a circular menu around the cursor to let you choose to use your eyes, mouth (for talking, drinking, etc), or hands, where applicable; if you can only do one of these, clicking will just do that. Right-click anywhere to bring up the inventory, or press A and D to cycle through it, and then click to use an item or to talk to someone about it.

Overall rating: $16.

25652829.review:
Just replayed this classic masterpiece some 15 years after my first run-through. And WOW does it hold up! A great old school adventure game of the point-and-click persuasion, with an amazing story, cool atmosphere and lengthy gameplay set in both a future bleak version of earth, as well as a magical fantasy alternative.

Unlike those extremely annoying old Sierra games where opening the wrong door, forgetting to pick up the red berry from the Evil Wizard's toilet 5 hours earlier, or just putting on the wrong pair of socks, will kill you instantly and set you back to your latest saved game where you'd still forgot to pick up the damned berry, TLJ encourages you to try everything. This game will never punish you for exploring, just like - for example - the original Monkey Island trilogy.

There were a couple of small but easily ignored graphical glitches on my Windows 8.1 rig, e.g. some characters walk around with slightly unmotivated see-through holes in their heads, but you don't play a game originally released in 1999 to dive into the realer-than-real pixelwork. This IS your parents' old adventure game. Also, if the Yes/No dialogue window turns out blank, kick it DOS style and just press 'y' for Yes. You'll be just fine.

Again: a classic adventure masterpiece. Highly recommended.

Up to now, 9/10

10/10 I am not exageratting

25537134.review:
Premier volet, indispensable uniquement si vous voulez vous faire toute la franchise.
Si on tient en compte les graphismes de l'époque, on saura apprécier quand même le style polygone grâce à des références de jeux réussis tels que les premiers Tomb Raider et FFVIII.
Le principe clic & point est un concept intéressant pour les fans du genre.

Les décors sont quand même beaux malgré la qualité du graphisme. Par contre, sur mon pc, j'ai certains éléments des personnages qui n'apparaissent pas (parfois y a des trous par lesquels on voit à travers eux, ou des personnages dont il manque l'arrière de la tête...) mais ce n'est pas trop dérangeant.

Mêler un univers cyber punk et heroic fantasy via 2 mondes parallèles est super original et c'est sans doute là que le jeu est intéressant et créatif.

Par contre, les points négatifs : 
Les casses-têtes sont parfois illogiques insupportables et impossible de les résoudre de façon instinctive!!
Rien qu'à cause de ça, je craignais m'être lancé dans une saga de jeu à détester (si le "joueur de grenier" ne faisait pas que dans les consoles, j'imagine qu'il aurai pondu une vidéo sur "The longest journey" qui n'aurai rien eu à envier à la logique du RPG "ALEX KID 2")...
Je m'explique en un exemple : 
difficile de deviner qu'on peut combiner un ballon avec une pince et un adhésif pour l'utiliser afin d'attraper un objet qui ne se trouve pas du tout dans le même secteur....
Parfois les énigmes m'agaçaient à tel point que ça me coupait tout le plaisir du jeu. J'avoue donc avoir plusieures fois regardé la soluce afin de terminer le jeu en évitant au possible d'en garder un trop mauvais souvenir.
Et encore, l'exemple des combinaisons est moindre car parfois il fallait combiner 2 objets dans un certain ordre... ce qui fait que lorsqu'on avait le malheur d'inverser l'ordre de combinaison impossible à deviner, ça faisait comme si les 2 objets n'étaient pas compatibles. Si on essaie pas dans les 2 sens, on peut passer à côté d'un truc en se disant que c'est incompatible... et continuer de chercher pour rien d'autres objets sur toute la carte......... et devenir fou!!

C'est vraiment ça que je craignais devoir subir aussi sur les suites de la franchise. 
Pour le premier, vu le nombre de fois où j'ai dû lire la soluce, j'ai envie de déconseiller son achat... mais dans ce cas, il est quand même indispensable pour vous de regarder le game playthought car les 2 autres volets valent le coup et font référence et suite à ce jeu.

Rassurez vous concernant les suites : les énigmes et combinaisons sont logiques, instinctives à partir du 2ème jeu et vous serez enfin accroc ;)

CONSEILS:
Concernant encore les petits problèmes d'affichages: quand vous quittez (par exemple), une fenêtre popup demandant confirmation - "YES / NO" est censée apparaitre, mais là elle s'affichera en blanc et vous ne verrez rien... 
Si vous avez installé le patch en français, appuyez sur la touche "O" du clavier pour "Oui" ou "N" pour "Non" (en anglais, ce sera donc "Y" pour "Yes" et "N" pour "No")

Le jeu est en anglais pour les 2 premiers volets : un patch fr est facilement trouvable sur le net et facile à installer si on suit les indications. Ensuite, à vous la liberté de choisir la langue et les sous titre dans les options du jeu.

[h1]Old School 3D Adventure Game[/h1]
Lot of people consider this among one of the best adventure games ever made for PC - i can see why after playing it. While the game has very good writing on story/dialogue i do feel some of the issues exist mostly on gameplay aspects.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Full spoken dialogue with great voice actors and cool dialogue overall that makes you giggle sometimes (Especially Crow)
    [*]Decent Soundtrack
    [*]April Ryan is actually a good female protagonist that doesn't fill female heroine stereotypes
[/list]

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The game doesn't offer options for resolution sizes nor windowed mode, very limited settings
    [*]Alt Tabbing on the game causes some issues, also the game changes your PC's font (Goes away after you reboot) Among this there were lot of bugs.
    [*]Sometimes it was hard to spot key items on the ground due to graphics, some of the textures were missing in certain angles for certain models
[/list]

24972711.review:
[b]The Longest Journey[/b]
An oldies with great gameplay. Don’t be taken aback by it’s low polygon graphic, it still have very good story and character personality. Once you play, you’ll be looking for the game’s sequel.

[u]Pro[/u]
[list]
[*]Very good story. With a bit of twist here and there. A fantasy well written. 
[*]Character with personality. If you feel attach to the character of a games, that’s a well written and acted character. You’ll love April Ryan, and Crow, especially Crow.
[*]Good and challenging puzzles. The puzzles are well made and not ridiculous as some point and click games are. If you need to do something, there’s a good reason behind it and there’s also a good logic on how doing something will affect the outcome. 
[/list]

[u]Con[/u]
[list]
[*]Graphic not at current standard. It’s a Y2K era game. What did you expect?
[*]The pop up menu not showing properly. When you click some menu and a “Yes or No” question pop up, it just showing a blank white rectangle. You can use keyboard (Y or N), but it might not be obvious at first.
[/list]

24458589.review: I felt compelled to play this game after having completed its follow up Dreamfall: The Longest Journey and that is the only caveat I feel is necessary to recommend this game. If you have an appreciation for the other games in the series than the completionist in you is the only reason to play this game. Graphically this game has not aged well and works counter to the fantasy/futuristic atmosphere that the game tries to create. The lead character April is somewhat interesting and well voice acted but almost all the other characters get very little attention and with regards to how it ends completely forgotten about. As a point and click it's equal parts rewarding and utterly nonsensical but thankfully you can enable the ESC button in the menu to skip through dialogue, slow moving character animations, cutscenes (They are unintentionally laughable) and to transition from the various locations you visit (and from one side of the screen to the other).

24437308.review: Had this close to i think 2 years? Finally finished it (more than half of the game I played without a walkthrough), and this was THE BEST, most fulfilling end to a game I've had in years!!! The old 90s classic style is so inviting, and the extensive storytelling had me hooked, even though it took long because of life duties lol. I'm not sad it ended, because at least the ending was so worth it, even though it's weird to not be on the Journey any longer. Lots of twists and turns, no cliches, and really this game seems like it was ahead for its time. So if you want a game that makes you feel like the devs really loved making themselves, with rich storytelling and equally beautiful fantasy and sci-fi worlds, this game is definitely for you! I give this game 10/5 stars!! ♥

24379527.review:
Here's a little background:  I actually played Dreamfall before I played The Longest Journey.  I happened to be unpackimg my original Xbox after moving and found a few games that I hadn't played yet; Dreamfall was one--it was still in its shrink wrap.  I knew nothing about Dreamfall except it was an adventure game with a pretty girl wearing a pink tank top on the cover.  It turned out to be an awesome game.  Ater playing it, I wondered if there was a sequel and purchased Dreamfall Chapters and started playing.  I then discovered that not only was Chapters being funded through Kickstarter, but there was a preceding game called The Longest Journey.  I immediately stopped playing Chapters and downloaded The Longest Journey to learn about April Ryan's adventures that led to Zoe's adventure in Dreamall.        

The Longest Journey is an old-school point-and-click adventure.  Initially, this was a little off-putting, but I quickly got into the hang of it and playing it soon became second nature.  The puzzles were fairly easy, though I did have to peek at a walkthrough once or twice--but I was more into uncovering the story arc than actually solving puzzles at the time.  It was a fun game, a grand adventure, and thoroughly explained the events that led to the later games.  I then went back to playing Chapters.  You don't need to play The Longest Journey to enjoy Dreamfall or Dreamfall Chapters, but it does help bring the whole story arc together if you play them all.  I wish I had played them in the right sequence.  

If you're playing Dreamall Chapters, I strongly suggest youy play The Longest Journey first, then Dreamfall, before continuing Chapters.

24180844.review:
Here's my review. I tell it in my own words, as is told by my teacher.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
都忘了是什么时候听说过这个叫好不叫座的游戏了，第三部都悄悄上架了，我才买到库里，下载下来一直没玩，因为分辨率定死了，画面不能增强，解谜类的坑也一直没进过，感觉体验不是很爽。直到最近，没网没手柄，才捡起来这个十多年前的point & click解谜游戏。

这绝对是一个不玩会后悔的游戏，尤其是对喜欢丰富的故事的玩家。流程颇长，故事非常引人入胜。觉得未来科幻并不那么有趣？游戏还有同样庞大或者更胜一筹的魔幻世界。神神叨叨的Venar人，好像爱丽丝梦游仙境中的白兔的Banda族，将讲授故事当作文化传承和课程的Alatien，与他们的互动都是很有趣的体验。Arcadia的剧情有几段简直像在扮演童话故事，机智的主人公用计谋击败邪恶的炼金术士。当然游戏也并不只是靠这些新奇的体验撑起来的，她有一个相当庞大的故事和世界观，甚至讲了16年三部游戏，坑还没有全部填完。

虽然没有足够好的画面，人物的一些动作也不知所云，但游戏出色的Voice Acting和对白完全能够抓的住玩家。很多给出的对话选项是非常搞怪无厘头的，让人忍不住想选，还有一些角色明明斩钉截铁的说了no，与其的对话选项则是软磨硬泡，令人捧腹。系列吉祥物Crow每次出场都是一出喜剧。在现代游戏中，虽然角色的表情、动作很多已经出神入化了，却往往并不比TLJ中这些脸都是马赛克的角色更加深入人心。幽默是很重要的一块。自然的幽默，使整个游戏放在现在也十分生动。

游戏的玩法部分被诟病不少。首先，这确实本质上是个传统的point & Click解谜游戏，受众确实很小，我基本上没有玩过这种游戏不太好详细的评论，不过TLJ中的有些谜题实在太让人摸不着头脑了。比如[spoiler]拿橡皮鸭子、钳子和绳子组合成的钥匙吊杆[/spoiler]，脑洞实在太大。还有就是谜题的设计问题，常常需要跑很远的路，获取一个道具，却并不知道这么大的一个游戏地图，究竟哪一个不起眼的角落能用到。[spoiler]Time sheet居然是夹在日记本里的，哪有游戏这么设计的。[/spoiler]所幸类似谜题基本上集中在游戏的开头部分，也可能是之后我习惯了，后来的几段精彩剧情并不会受令人头疼的解谜的影响，体验还是非常不错的。

就像我以前形容某国产游戏所说的，The longest journey虽然很老，但并没有代沟，甚至还能带给玩家不少独一无二的体验。画面其实真不是问题，能静下心来，好好体验一下这个游戏，应当会是你玩家生涯很美好的一段时光。

Эта игра волшебна. Начало трилогии "Бесконечных путешествий", вышедшее почти 17 лет назад, покорила сердца миллионов геймеров по всему миру, и я в их числе. Через месяц, год или десятилетие - это лишь вопрос времени, но вы наверняка захотите переиграть этот шедевр.

24043438.review:
[h1]TLJ, a pleasant odessey...[/h1]

I landed on this game because I wanted to play what originated the story from Dreamfall Chapters, and while this is a 1999 game, I was very very pleased. Like they say, they don't make stuff to last like before nowadays!

[u]Graphics[/u]
Well, this is a game from 1999, so forget about it, you cannot play this game expecting HD textures, expect Nintendo 64-like graphics at its best, with old Diablo-like cutscenes, nor there are any mods to that I could find to help with this, this is most unimportant anyway, since the true treasure of this game lies elsewhere. [b]However,[/b] I do find appealing all the drawn scenarios, thinking of all the work that went through the creation of this game to make all the world, I absolutely love it. Also, just as me, you'll probably have find issues with the graphics, with 3D models looking incomplete, this can be easily fixed by following the instruction in [url=http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=558693]THIS[/url] thread, easy peesy! The music and sound effects used always suits the areas you find yourself in, although only in some very specific ocasions I found the music to be of special notice, it was just pretty much suitable, makes you feel in the right ambient.

[u]The Story[/u]
That is truly the point of this really, no? What is a point-and-click adventure game without its story. I must say, I had some expectations and they were fullfilled, I deeply enjoyed the story in this game. I won't go on the details, for what I love of the story is to be able to discover it as you progress, every little piece of it, and I won't take that away from you. Mind you, there is something you should know, this game is young adult-oriented, so be warned about the content you might expect to find in the dialogues. That said, if you have lots of crops on your sense of humor field, this game will certainly make you harvest them all, the characters are quite hilarious, sarcasm is the everyday bread, and witty verbal knives fly here and there. Even when it wants you to feel omnious, it keeps making you chuckle.This game makes you love its characters, so you are more inclined to care about the story has a whole. And the voice acting...is truly grandious. This is how I like my stories told to me. My favorite character without doubt was [spoiler]Crow[/spoiler], it is are amazing. And man, this had gotten me 20h to complete, I did not expect that either, the game is appropiately long.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
Well, this is an old game so if you are used to have clear aids on games, be aware this has none of it. By "clear aids" I mean like "objetives menu" "map", etc. No, you do have "story follow up" materials that help you remember what just happened and might be expected to do, and lets you review the conversations you had with NPCs should you have forgotten something important that they said, however apart from that do not expect any kind of leads or explicit help.
The puzzles can go from simple to "OH MY GOD, REALLY?", sometimes it requires you to push and get going on those  abstract thinking processes to be able to figure out what it wants you to do, makes your inner celeron dust its core quite a bit for sure. If you are truly lost, do not worry, it is acceptable that you might end up in a game guide at some point because some of them are quite tricky...very tricky...let's say. How to succed at completing this game though? My recomendations are the following:
*From the very start, ALWAYS check everything in your scenario, everytime your scenario changes (whereas you went to a whole new area or you simply decided to take a look at something specific, scan it thoroughly, and see if you can interact with it in some way, or interact with items in some way. If you can grab something it -WILL- have an use or various uses along your journey, so keep always an eye peeled. One item you might have overlooked, and it might prove problematic later on, so be very vigilant, and very curious.
*Pay special attention to what has been said by the NPCs.
*Keep track of the details, and track of what you have in your inventory so it is easier to connect the dots with the help of your logic skills! The way you have to interact in with your environment always appeals in great deal to your logic (*Stark-ing intensifies* lol).

[h1]Overall?[/h1]
I would venture to say that this is a masterpiece. Despite the fact that I could send this game to be carbon-dated already, it surprised me as it surpassed my expectations. I was a little dubious when I purchased it despite having loved Dreamfall Chapters, but I absolutely do not regret it a single bit. I enjoyed every single chapter, and should you, reader, stumble over this title by chance, know that you are in for a treat, and one hell of worth it. And if you decide to give it a shot, I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
This is the way storytelling should be.

23820530.review:
It's not entirely correct that this game released in 2000 as the game description says (this is the UK release), it was first released in Norway in 1999. 

I first played through TLJ in 1999 and I always found the graphics quite impressive for its time. In fact it seemed years ahead of the competition, I knew of no other beautifully detailed game quite like this. Back then there were no walkthroughs. Since I was also a child, seemingly easy puzzles sometimes took me days to figure out. I spent more than a month getting through the entire game (also because I wasn't allowed to game ALL day). This game left such a massive imprint on me and my imagination. I love the magical ambience of the game, the music, the main character (which, at least in norwegian, was kind of funny), the backgrounds and scenery, the places to travel to and the puzzles. Also, the controls were easy to use and the menus easy to manuver. Being able to skip long dialogues (perhaps accidentially revisited) with the right mouse button made things even easier. The only thing I felt a little negative about first playing this game was that there was A LOT of walking, even tho April runs she doesn't run fast enough! And a lot of dialogue where they go into great detail on almost everything. In my 2016 playthrough tho I find these long dialogues interesting, cause they fill in the gaps where I had holes in my understanding of the story. I'm also now more interested in knowing more about the characters and places because they're now distantly familiar. As a kid, some of the story was hard to make sense of. Yet through actions and imagery it all made sense in the end. 

Wenever I think of The Longest Journey I get that magical feeling kids get around christmas time; anticipation. This game always had me curious of what would happen next. I'm so happy this game is available on Steam for newer generations to play, and for old-time players to revisit and reminiscence. I hope to one day see a remastered version with polished up graphics!

(The only bug I've so far encountered playing on Windows 10 is that I can't exit the game because a white box appears. But a quick google searched showed that you get asked to end the game by pressing "y" for yes and "n" for no. So far this has worked)

One of the things I definitely notice between then and now is how much more action focused our games have got - I was getting really frustrated with how slowly she travelled and walked to places.

23677368.review:
Just finished the game. Loved it. When I first started out, I was only half-interested in anything the characters were saying. Mind you, I'm playing this in 2016, so everything felt very 'been-there-done-that'. The further you progress into the story, however, the more you get pulled into it, into all of it, the world, the characters, everything. Talking about those characters- it just, it always amazes me how developers can pull of creating alternate worlds, the different creatures they invented were all just so darned likeable, especailly the Bandu. And it has to be said, for a 1999 game, it's very modern. It had a bunch of stuff in it that nowadays people tend to make a big deal out of, like a lesbian character and a wide variety of races, oh, and did I mention, blatant profanity just like in real life.

As for some of the more technical stuff. The voice acting was great, and everything was voiced over. I know that's possible with games like these because they tend to be smaller in size, but it really helps a ton with immersion. Sure, the graphics are from 1999 and sometimes you're not sure whether that's a face or a melted candle, but at least everyone's got stellar voices to go with their retro looks. Besides, the sceneries were lovely, just the characters that looked a bit clunky. As for the gameplay, it was just the basic point-and-click stuff, required some quick/clever thinking at times. Only thing I couldn't stand was April's walking speed, girl get a move on, buuut I could just speed my way through any animation that took too long for my liking, so that wasn't really a problem either.  I think if I'd have any serious "issue" (I say "issue" because it didn't actually bother me) it's that I felt no real emotional connection to most of the characters, so whenever anything happened to them, it didn't bother me, but I think when it comes to creating emotional connections to characters, you just need more time with em than a game like this can give you, so I wouldn't really chock it up as a flaw. 

Overall ratings:
Audio: 9/10
Graphics: 8/10*
Gameplay: 7.5/10
Story: 10/10

*keeping in mind it's from 1999, and the sceneries were very good

23505492.review:
It feels a little pointless to review a game that came out 16 years ago, but I had to throw my hat into the opinion ring - I absolutely adored this game so I felt duty bound to gush about it a little. Plus, having never played it when it first came out, it's brand new to me.

The Longest Journey is as long as the name suggests. The amount of content for a point and click game is phenomenal. And describing the story as anything less than epic would be like describing the Great Wall of China as a bit long.

Set in two worlds, one woven with magic and filled with dragons and fantastical creatures, and one in a slightly bleak but tech-filled future, this is a must for point and click adventure fans. The Longest Journey has a wonderfully told story, which equal parts intriguing, touching, engaging and funny. With only a handful of exceptions, the voice acting is equally stellar, and the puzzles pitched just right (I did need to use a walkthrough on a couple of occasions, but hey, what's new).

Although the graphics are a little dated due to the age of the game - the sprites and animation is dire in places - the backgrounds are beautiful.

My biggest - probably only - gripe with the game is that it takes an age to move your character from screen to screen (even if you're running). Top tip (which sadly I only found out towards the end) - if you enable it in the settings, the escape key will skip those bits for you.

All in all, this game was an unforgettable experience and even at full price is worth every penny.

In short: Very good. 8/10
Pro's: Excellent story telling. Marvellous fantasy. Easy to play. Solid fun, no noticable bugs.
Con's: Graphics are very outdated, would love a Remastered version :). Conclusion left me a bit... meh'ed.

To me this game is proof that you don't need full HD super graphics to have a wonderfull time. The game begins slow and doesn't overwhelm you with information. But soon enough magic and mystery is all around you. Although I totally love the fantasy of this game, I do recognise where some idea's came from and feel that some plot moments could have been worked out better. None the less, having missed this in the past, I played it for the first time in 2016 and was left wanting more! Fortunately, there is :)
TLJ is never boring, the puzzles are never frustratingly unlogical, there is plenty of humor and you are always wondering what will come next. The only frown I got was at the conclusion where the ending was much different than expected and a little bit of an anti-climax.

If you love story telling and if you're not hung up on the latest graphical achievents, then I'd recommend this game 100%.

22613025.review:
少女April Ryan和其他所有青少年拯救世界的故事开端一样，是命中注定的那个chosen one，突然被牵扯进一件大阴谋里，魔法和科技，2个世界的命运都系于她一人，随之为我们展现了一段惊心动魄的冒险旅程。这是2000年的作品，全屏画质不可避免的是马赛克，游戏里的部分谜题也不是很友好，但除此之外，全程配音，悦耳的BGM，丰富的场景细节，用心扎实的故事文本，无疑The Longest Journey堪称是一部恢弘的冒险游戏巨制。无怪乎许多网站在评AVG游戏的历史最佳榜单时，TLJ的排名几乎都在前3之列。 作为一款传统AVG，一只鼠标包办全部操作，游戏流程颇长，所以周末的下午冲杯热饮，慵懒地坐在靠椅上玩TLJ，肯定是一种无比惬意的享受。

游戏已经有16个年头了，其故事，内涵，寓意，经典自不必我在这里赘述。但这里我还是忍不住额外提2点妙笔生花之处，让我很有感触：

1.	游戏用老奶奶讲故事的方式来做引子和结尾，加上双重世界设定，又勾起了小时候的很多美好回忆，一个是おやゆび姫物语(拇指姑娘)，另外一个是青いブリンク(青色杜马)，相对许多热血动画，这2部可能相对冷门一点，不晓得还有没有玩家记得?

2.	游戏里的魔法世界里有几处场景可以让玩家看到一些展现游戏世界观的史料文献，其中嵌套着好几个小故事，耐心的都看了下来，真的很精彩。就好像俄罗斯套娃一样，非常有趣，还记得里面有个鱼人和渔人的故事，其恩将仇报最终被反噬的情节使我联想到了九色鹿的故事。我不否认我非常喜欢这种设计，尤其是这些小故事是完整的，不是只言片语的修饰物故弄玄虚。

最后摘录翻译一段游戏内的我自己非常喜爱的小故事(和主线剧情无关，所以不用怕剧透)，各位看官就能了解为什么我说TLJ的文本很扎实了，故事的名字叫做《回家的故事》：
------------------------------>
Moran是一位英俊的Alatien族青年，他拥有强壮的翅膀和坚硬的喙。他住在白崖之下，那里充盈着咸咸海水和丰富鱼群。Moran已经和Anara订婚了，Anara容貌美丽，身材修长，她的眼睛如一抹清澈的蓝色浅影，是那儿最漂亮的女孩。

但Moran始终迟疑要不要和Anara组成家庭，生儿育女，成为她的丈夫。每每念及此，他总会找一个新的借口来拖延，来搪塞为什么他们应该再等一等。现在Anara已经精于制做陶罐，但她更熟知故事和传奇，村子里的讲述者已经多次邀请Anara来做她的学徒，来学习村子所有的传说典故，将来继承她的衣钵。但是Anara拒绝了，因为她知道一旦成为了讲述者，她将永远不能嫁给Moran，因为依据传统讲述者不能有丈夫，不能有自己的孩子。她不愿成为讲述者学徒的事情是村子里闻所未闻的，试问谁能拒绝一份如此无尚的荣耀呢？但之于Anara来说，爱情更为重要。她对Moran的爱超越了荣誉，超越了常理。不过尽管Anara的爱如此热诚，Moran还是犹豫不决。

之后某一天，他对Ananra说到“我打算远游去到遥远之滨进行一场朝圣之旅。我会离开一段时间，在此期间鉴于习俗，我将会暂时摆脱我们间婚约的束缚，直到我归来之日誓约将会再度恢复。”在当时来说一个年轻的Alatien族男子出去朝圣的情况并不少，婚约中断然后归期再续也是司空见惯。但是Anara心碎了，因为她原以为Moran不久便要迎娶她过门了。当Moran看到她落下的泪珠时说道，“请不要哭泣。等我回来后，我发誓我会娶你的。你只需要耐心等就行了，继续制作陶罐， 这样会让时间过得快些。” 就这样，Moran去向遥远之滨进行朝圣去了。

许多年过去了，Moran也在遥远之滨体验过了种种激动人心的冒险。渐渐地他开始思乡，开始渴望Anara，如今他终于意识到自己是爱她的，他想要娶她为妻。但当他回到故乡，发现在制陶工里已经不见了Anara的倩影。他又跑到她家去找，才得知多年漫长的等待无果，Anara答应做了讲述者的学徒……就在去年冬天最后一阵风刮过之时，老讲述者离世了，Anara自己成为了新的讲述者。

愤怒了，Moran径直奔向讲述者的巢穴，一看到Anara就说，“你答应过会等我的！”但Anara没有回一个字。她转身从背后的小床上拎出个用树叶裹着的包袱递给Moran，Moran解开包袱一看，里面是一个旧陶罐，而且裂成了两半。

“这罐子是什么意思？”他问到。“你为什么没有照我说的等我呢？”

终于Anara开口了，她对Moran说道，“我亲爱的Moran，这个陶罐是你当初离开的时候，我特意为你而制作的，因为我想把它作为一个结婚礼物送给你。但是那么多年过去了，我最终意识到你爱我的方式和我爱你的不一样，我愿意执子之手与子偕老，否则情愿赴死。

“但我现在想要娶你了！”Moran忍不住哭了出来。“我回来了啊！”

但Anara只是对着Moran手里的破陶罐微微点了点头说，“就如同这个陶罐，无人呵护弃之一旁，哪怕是一颗心也会碎成两半的……”

就这样Anara转身离去了，从此再也没有和Moran说过话。而Moran的心也好似被遗弃的陶罐一样，碎成了两半。因为长久的分离会使一颗心变的脆弱易碎……而一颗破裂的心是永远无法再弥合的。

A fantastic point and click adventure with a very memorable protagonist. The voice acting, especially for the protagonist April Ryan, is wonderful and adds to the immersion. Most of the puzzles are great, though there's the occasional esoteric one that may require a look-up. I played this game for the first time in 2008 and loved it, and just replayed it in 2016 and loved it again. If you can handle old school 3D graphics it's still well worth your time even decades after release.

Highly recommended for anyone who wants to experience an adventure with a heavy focus on story and characters.

22290066.review:
This game has some challenging puzzles, is rather slow, has some interesting characters, but it is really nice. I recommend this game to anyone, who wants to play out a really nice story that is more heavy on the dialogue and the text than the action.

The characters are certainly one of the best parts, and April as well as her friends made it a very enjoyable journey for me. The game felt really slow at times, especially when you had to wait for the characters to slowly move before they began dialogue, continued the story, or just allowed you to click around again. It certainly felt slower than what I have gotten used used to, but then again it is a long time since I played point and click adventure games.

The game is very dialogue and text heavy, but it kinda compliments the games slow pace and atmosphere. A few times it got annoying if the character was too weird or dull, but mostly April Ryan's personality made me enjoy it the game as a whole, as well as the diverse environment and cast.

I only experienced one minor bug during my playthrough. When trying to save the game, return to the main menu, and close the game, the "are you sure window" just showed up as a white square. But after I realized I just had to press "y" or "n", so i didn't need to see it, it didn't really interfere much in the game or outside of it. So yeah, pretty happy I was able to play the game with no real problems. 
Though the "40+ hours gameplay" that it promised in the about section doesn't really seem right... But I had already seen the time on other people's reviews so I didn't actually expect it.

21960622.review:
This game is really amazing. It is about 16 years old now, and it is stil comparable to some of the great games of today. The graphis were awesome I'm sure (~2000), but to some younger players the game may appear a bit Minecraftish. The story follows a heroin that goes form Art student to the destiny of becoming a savior of two worlds. While initially taking place in the far future of the Earthen city of New Venice she finds herself learning about "magic" and powers she has had since birth. 

The characters in this game are well-developed and the main character herself, April Ryan, is quite funny and sarcastic. Both the conversations and her personal journal are humourous to read. The settings are really well thought of, and the futurisitc corruption of coporations are placed. It is a point-and-click game that is worth the money.  Also, if you're thinking of buying this game for your children you might want to wait until they're a bit older. (Lots of profanity and sexual references). 

More about the game play....

THIS NEXT PART MAY HAVE MINOR SPOILERS 

The game itself isn't too difficult to complete. It plays as more of a story with some actions, rather than actions that contribute to a story. It does have the typical puzzle solving that most point-and-click games have. I would say in general about 95% of the puzzles can be solved without too much difficulty. There were a couple of times I had to "cheat" by looking up walkthroughs. That rubber duck contraption to get the key in the railway was ridiculous. Also having to knock three times specficially to get the garage door open was kind of pushing it.  I ended up with some items that I'm not sure if I was supposed to use or not. 

I was a bit dissapointed that we never got to see what became of her art show and other tidbits about her personal life. Although, I read about Dreamfall and plan on eventually playing that. I'm curious if they're going to pick up on April's personal life in the sequel. I read mostly in online forums that her breast size changes. I guess that's what matters.

21702808.review:
Cela faisait un certain moment que je lorgnais autour de la licence de Funcom qui a déjà fait beaucoup parler d'elle. A la base, je ne suis pas un fin connaisseur des points & click et autres jeux d'aventures et ce même si j'ai énormément apprécié les Runaway de Pendulo. Du coup j'hésitais et j'ai passé un long moment à lire les différents tests tout en visionnant quelques séquences de gameplay.
Finalement, j'ai sauté le pas en achetant les deux premier opus de la licence et bigre, je ne regrette absolument pas !



Le gameur briscard se plait à dire [i]"Fiston, d'mon temps c'était mieux avant"[/i]. C'est souvent vrai,surtout  lorsque l'on voit la propension mercantile de certains éditeurs qui nous font bouffer leur licence AAA à coup de marketing bien placé. Au final, l'on se retrouve bien souvent avec un bon jeu mais très loin de nous offrir un plaisir vidéo ludique hors-norme. Pour ce faire, beaucoup aime retrouver les vieilles licences, celles qui ont d'ores et déjà acquis un statut "d'oeuvre culte". 

C'est le cas pour The Longest Journey. Sorti en 1999 (Oui, ça commence à faire un bail), le jeu avait fait parler de lui pour son scénario, très bien écris et son ambiance. Car oui, ce qui m'a profondément marqué dans ce jeu est tout simplement l'ambiance qui s'y dégage. Celle d'une véritable aventure onirique où le féerique côtoie la science-fiction, où l'ont parle de Dragon, d'industrialisation et d'expériences scientifiques. De prime à bord, l'on pourrait penser que c'est un mélimélo de tout ce qui se fait de bon dans le genre. Hérésie de penser ça car les norvégiens de Funcom savent écrire, c'est un fait et ils s'en sont diablement bien sorti dans The Longest Journey.

Le joueur incarne une jeune fille nommée April Ryan et elle est loin de la bimbo hyper sexualisée que le jeux-vidéo est généralement capable de nous offrir, surtout à cette époque. L'on se retrouve plutôt devant une étudiante en art qui va rapidement se retrouver embarquée dans une aventure faite de prophéties, qui va la dépasser. Pour son héroïne, le jeu vaut déjà le coup. April nous gratifiera très souvent de ses pensées et de ses sarcasmes par le biais d'un journal intime ou de ses interventions dans les conversations. Amusante, cohérente et très humaine, April Ryan est un personnage comme ont aimerait en voir plus souvent. Il en va de même pour les personnages secondaires. Même si l'on échappera pas aux stéréotypes du genre (Le Mentor, le gros méchant despotique, le sidekick (Rôle tenu par un Corbeau. Oui, un piaf.) , ils sont très bien écrit et, pour la plupart, très amusant. J'ai d'ailleurs été très agréablement surpris par la qualité des doublages et du jeu d'acteur. Pour l'époque, les doubleurs sont très bien dans leur rôle et c'est tant mieux car ils énooooooooormément de choses à dire.

C'est un fait, le jeu est très bavard et c'est, malheureusement, souvent pour ne rien dire. L'on se retrouve pas mal de fois devant des dialogues à rallonge. Si, quelques fois, c'est justifié et amène des informations du lore, d'autres fois j'ai vraiment ressenti comme une impression de remplissage assez désagréable. L'époque n'aidant pas, la mise en scène statique est parvenue à me laisser décrocher lors de quelques dialogues ce qui, toutefois, n'a pas gêné ma progression.

Au niveau des graphismes ... Mince quoi, le jeu n'a pas pris de coup d'vieux. Malgré une résolution bloquée, les paysages sont somptueux et la modélisation est très correcte pour la fin des années 90. Le jeu va nous faire voyager et vous allez réellement "voir du pays". L'on évitera cependant pas les aller-retour typique des jeux du genre mais cela ne gènera nullement les habitués. 


Bref, The Longest Journey est, pour moi, un incontournable. Un jeu qui sera parvenu à me happer dés les premières scènes. Un jeu cohérent de sa narration, cohérent dans ses paysages et son écriture. Un jeu onirique, à l'ambiance unique. Je ne suis absolument pas déçu d'en avoir fait l'acquisition et le recommande à tout ceux qui hésiteraient à faire "le grand saut". Franchement, il vaut le coup.

21334558.review:
I keep wanting to call this game my favourite of all time. but there are two or three other games that I think I like just as much.  This is the only one, though, for which I've kept the original box.  In any event. no game has ever matched it for story and character development.  The actual gameplay consists of puzzle solving (at times brilliant and challenging, but occassionally nonsensically contrived) and dialogue selection, but the value is in the imaginative story that it tells and the artwork that supports it.

It's hard to say how someone new to the series would take to the game now, as it was an oddity even when it came out.  The pacing and feel are not like any other game, and for those reasons alone it's worth checking out.  The story is adventure fantasy, but with such rich, endearing, and philisophical inventiveness that it plays like a piece of grand literature.

It's one of the classics and I have revisited it many times over the years.  I strongly recommend it.

This is one of the best point and click adventure games I've ever played. The story is so engrossing, it was often hard to stop for the night. If you're a fan of the genre, you must play this. Several times, I found myself thinking it reminded me of Gabriel Knight, so if you liked that, that's a good sign.

I do have 3 complaints. First, there were a few puzzles where I thought the solutions were absurd. I had to look at a walkthrough about 3 times, fairly early in the game. Second, there are LONG unpausable conversations. Finally, you can't play it at anything but its native 640x480 resolution, so it's stretched and badly pixelated at fullscreen on a modern 16:9 screen. Don't let these things stand in your way, though. It's a great game.

21291602.review:
I feel like I'm about halfway through with the game right now, so I think it's safe to give a review.

The Longest Journey is a point and click adventure game that delves into both high fantasy and futuristic themes. It does both very well, and in a seamless way that doesn't feel like the developers are trying to force two unrelated genres into their game forcefully. The story, thus far, is good. It's easy to follow, but also deeper than you'll initially think, going into the game. Puzzles are challenging, but not impossible. Most of them are fairly easy to figure out once you get into the right frame of thought, or just going at them with trial and error. Voicework is good, and the characters are charming and likable. 

The graphics are dated, but this shouldn't deter you from getting the game. I bought it when it was 80% off, but I would still pay full price for it. 

With that said, I've found some problems playing the game. I cannot overwrite saves, otherwise it causes the game to freeze. I've been getting around this by making multiple saves and deleting the ones I'm done with to save on space. Also, When I try to exit the game through the in-game menu, it also causes the game to freeze. Again, I find it an easy fix  by just opening up the task manager and ending the process that way. As easy as it is to get around these issues, I think I should share my issues with it.

21283407.review:
Dieses Spiel möchte ich an dieser Stelle jedem Adventure-Freund und überhaupt PC-Spieler mit einem Sinn für gute Geschichten ans Herz legen.

Dies ist eines meiner All-Time-Favorite Spiele und nach etwa 20 Jahren Video-  und PC-Spielen immer noch als einziges Adventure unter meinen persönlichen Top-5.

Dies ist ein Spiel, das ich als Schüler im Erscheinungsjahr 1999 zusammen mit einem Klassenkameraden gekauft habe und bis heute immer wieder mal gern installiere. 
Mit dem Kauf hier bei Steam erwerbe ich dieses Spiel zum dritten Mal! ;)
Leider haben es die beiden Nachfolger nicht ganz geschafft, an die Qualität in Story und Spiel sowie den Charme des ersten Teils heranzukommen. Schade.
Bei meinen anderen beiden Lieblingsadventures 'Geheimakte Tunguska' und 'Black Mirror' schaffen es die Entwickler, das alle drei Teile gefühlt etwa die gleiche Qualität haben.
Hier sticht dagegen der erste Teil weit heraus, der zweite ist nach einem etwas lahmen Start durchaus fesselnd, und der dritte Teil ist dann eigentlich nur noch ganz nett.
Könnte wohl daran liegen, wieviel Zeit hier zwischen den einzelnen Spielen vergangen ist. Vielleicht hat sich auch beim Entwickler in der Zeit zu viel geändert.

Auf jeden Fall ist dieses Spiel ein absolut geniales.

PS: Wo bleibt eigentlich das HD-Remake, wenn man mal eins braucht? :O

From a story standpoint it is excellent. From a gameplay standpoint... not as much. I'm sure it was groundbreaking when it came out. Now it is just slow. 21218384.review:
I was looking for a game with a good story-line, I love being embraced by a fantastic world where I really get into it and feel like I am personally in it physically, mentally and emotionally. I am glad I gave "The Longest Journey" the chance, it didn't meet all those I stated, but it Indeed does have a fantastic story with great characters and settings. At first I did not really get into the game as it was a "Point & Click" type of game, plus it is quite old being released in 1999, with a few graphical tweaks I got the game working and looking decent with rendering issues. 

To be quite frankly honest I did start this game quite some time ago, but never really got into it and put it aside, and I am glad I gave it a second chance as I could not stop and was always wondering what would happen next as the story picked up and drove me in.

So I'll give a basic overview of the story but I won't touch on it too much as I don't want to give too much away.
You are April Ryan, an 18 year old girl who ran away from home and moved to a new city to start a new life at an Art School Academy, working at a crummy cafe and living in a tiny room in a bording house with fellow students and friends. Stark is a futuristic world, in which you live in you yourself live in a place called "Newport". Life is going okay, your "average" student life and attempting to keep yourself alive with little pay until one day everything changes. April starts having strange dreams, and soon these strange things and creatures start burrowing into the real world, a mysterious man named "Cortez" helps you and guides you to your destiny. He tells and shows you a whole new world called "Arcadia" in which only "Shifters" can travel too, and April unknowingly is a Shifter, during her journey between Two World to restore the "Balance", April must confront many different trials in order to prepare for restoring the Balance, along the way she meets new friends that help her on her Journey. April has alot to take in, she must keep her sanity and focus on saving both worlds, as she only has a few days to do it.

The Gameplay, "The Longest Journey" is a point and click game, which I didn't mind after awhile I got used to it. That being said this game is quite "Hard", keep that in mind as it forces you to obtain items, combine items, and use items at certain moments, It may sound simple as I word it but It can become a mind bottling headache to attempt to figures out what to do next, there is also ridiculuous puzzles combinations such as "The Rubber Ducky" and others that will make you cringe when you do finnaly figure it out (If your lucky enough), most people tend to just look up a walkthrough though I prefer to figure it out myself. Let your imagination run wild with combining items, trust me the "stupidest" combo or use of an item you can think of will probably help you proceed to the next part of the game.

The Dialogue system is something I really enjoyed, your conversations can have many different turn outs depending on what you choose to say, you can be mean and crude or friendly and nice even silly in your responses to characters. April also keeps a Diary that you can access in the menu and ready her thoughts on her day to day activities, and struggles with everything that is occuring, all your dialogue you have chosen is also stored in the menu.

Overall the game can be difficult, but the pay off is from the Story, Environment & Characters you meet along the way (Also the cheesy voice acting). This game has lots of great references to things in real life which is quite funny, but please note this game does have alot of Profanity in it (Swearing, Sexual References etc..) its better suited for an older audience.

The Longest Journey is a game that is hard to get into at first, but once you finnaly do it does certainly pay off.

20572844.review:
PROS: Unique story, lovable characters, tons of worldbuilding
CONS: Dated graphics, buggy features, obscure puzzles
OVERALL SCORE: 9/10

The Longest Journey is a classic game, and I think it absolutely deserves to be remembered throughout video game history. It's a monumental game, and one I can't recommend enough that people play.

The best thing about The Longest Journey is, hands down, its story. You play April Ryan, and young art student who's just found out she's a "shifter" - a chosen one who has to maintain the balance between two worlds - Arcadia, a world of magic, and Stark, a world of technology. Both worlds are rich in lore and fascinating to explore, and the characters you explore with are witty and charming. There's never a dull moment in The Longest Journey. 

I think my favorite things about the game is the way it breaks stereotypes. Not just in our protagonist, considering female protagonists were very rare at that time, but the twist at the end. The subversion of the "chosen one" trope so frequent in fantasy stories was really awesome to me, even though it was heartbreaking in execution. The ending to the game broke my heart, I'd grown so close to April and her sidekick, Crow, that seeing them both suffer disappointment made me so sad. It was an amazing feeling to connect with characters like that, and one reason I'll always recommend The Longest Journey.

One thing to remember about The Longest Journey is that it was released in 1999. It's a seventeen year old game, as of writing. But it still warrants saying... the graphics didn't age well. The backgrounds actually still look really pretty, but the characters look really blocky and low-res. For people who are used to realistic, high res textures, it can be jarring. Still, it's worth it to try to appreciate this game for what it was at the time of its release. Along with the graphics, another product of its age is the bugs. I didn't encounter a ton, but the ones I did were frustrating. There was a particular issue with saving and loading saves that I kept having, I couldn't overwrite a save spot and I couldn't load a save while playing, without the game crashing. Thankfully, that was the only major one I encountered, and I was able to play through the whole game without too many problems as long as I didn't mess with saving too much.

Outside of the age, my other complaint was a pretty typical one for adventure games - some of the puzzles just don't make sense. Here's looking at you, rubber ducky. There were some really great puzzles in The Longest Journey, but I found it got bogged down by what I can only describe as video game logic. You basically have to scour environments for random objects just because. It doesn't make sense in the actual game's logic, we just do it because we know we'll need that random piece of chewing gum later down the line. 

However, frustrating puzzles aside, this game is truly great. Experience the story for yourself. Honestly, this whole trilogy is great and definitely worth playing.

20534632.review:
This game is definitely one of the best point and click games out. Although the game was maybe a little too long (Hence the name 'The Longest Journey') it kept me entertained and engrossed in the storyline. You come across multiple quests and puzzles, escaping death throughout the game to continue on with the experience. There's not too much to say without spoiling the story but if you are a fan of point and click games, this really is a must play.

Pros:

- Well Written Narrative
- Excellent Voice Acting
- Characters Felt Realistic

Cons:

- A couple of compatibility issues with later OS versions

Score: 9/10

Now onwards to the sequel! Dreamfall: The Longest Journey!

20234500.review:
7 out of 10

I played TLJ2 Dreamfall a long time before (I didn't know it was a sequel), and although I forgot everything about the plot, I remember I really liked it so I wanted to replay the game when I learned that Chapters was already finished. I decided to play TLJ1 first. Kinda regretting it, but I'd still play this game if I were to make the choice again.

Waaaaaaaay too many slow, expositions of dialogues that made me want to pull my hair out, and at times I felt I was forcing myself through the game when it got to those long, never-ending dialogues. Everyone was so long-winded I wanted to scream at them. But, I am not one to skip dialogue/scenes, so I always want to make sure I squeeze out every answer for every available question. Since I don't like to cheat with the walkthroughs unless I'm stuck, that part on that Alatian Island or something was excrutiating to say the least. 

In terms of character development, April, the MC, was at times very annoying, but other times ok or bordering likeable. I liked Crow, however. Overall April and Crow did make me laugh a few times, so out of the painful monologues there were a few gem lines here and there. At least the characters themselves sometimes acknowledge that other characters sounded corny and fake as hell.

Voice acting - uh. Sometimes they just got on my nerves, sorry. The villains especially...so typical, those villainy voices. Anyhow I was not impressed but voice acting is not a deal-breaker for me considering I played FFX and still really liked it.

The good thing about the game was naturally the mystery solving and adventuring parts - they were fun, and some were not very obvious so I had to look up walkthroughs. Would have liked more of those as opposed to monologs, but thankfully I remember Dreamfall was a vast improvement. I didn't have high expectations about the adventuring part, since it was a fairly old game.

I won't say anything about how the game looked, because again it's an old game so my expectations were low. Needless to say I'm looking forward to healing my eyes somewhat when I replay Dreamfall.

In terms of plot, I didn't really like the whole deal with the destiny/prophecy cliches - those were too convenient and my brain does not really like those plot devices. Overall, however, the game was a decent journey. Would have liked more wrapping up at the end, but meh I guess I'll just play Dreamfall to refresh on what happens after that. [SPOILER] All I remember from Dreamfall was this little creepy girl telling the MC to save April Ryan, and that I thought April was a b*tch[/SPOILER]

All in all I can only say I'm neutral about this game. Since this is where it all starts, I still think this is probably a must-play if you're like me and you have this OCD about story completeness and you have a compulsion to play every game in a series and play them in order.

20224213.review:
Definitely one of the best point & click adventures I've ever played.

The puzzles are mostly really easy to figure out. There are only a few harder but still managable ones. If I still got stuck - which happened quite often - I just took a look into a walkthrough. But that wasn't because I couldn't solve a riddle, sometimes the game just doesn't give you any hint at all on what's your next (illogical) step, there are some easily missable items and sometimes you have to trigger an event by looking at some insignificant thing in the environment.

However, the greatest thing about this game is its story. It's exciting, you always feel that you're getting forward and you find a lot of lore throughout the game.
So basically there are two worlds: The logical world Stark, which is basically a dystopian future of our own, and the magical Arcadia, which is some kind of a dream world. (Notice the Lovecraft reference? It's not the only one)
The game keeps putting you in both of them, whereever you are it feels entirely different but it still manages to make sense.

There are few things I don't like about The Longest Journey, for example the epilogue was kind of pointless and there are some things that could have been explained better, but really, the pros overweigh the cons by far.
